tropeNotes: [Above Good and Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AboveGoodAndEvil): Much more of the Nietzschean variety than the watered-down and definitely villainous version that currently constitutes the actual trope. When asked his feelings about opposing an enemy who is "pure evil," Squall reflects that he's not so sure there's any such thing, considering good and evil to be largely a matter of perspective. This happens before the guiding hand of character development sets in, but even late in the game he remains motivated more by the desire to protect Rinoa and the rest of his friends than by any sense of "the right thing to do."

[The Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAce): Handsome, brave, dedicated, considerably skilled and powerful, as well as an excellent commander and strategist in the making. He doesn't see himself as such however and has to overcome his insecurities to fully become the trope.

[The Aloner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAloner): Briefly, in the end, sequence.  (SPOILER) He gets lost in time after defeating Ultimecia and wanders around aimlessly, alone, a fittingly ironic fate given his antisocial behavior earlier in the game. Fortunately, Rinoa manages to find him and they return to their time.

[Always Accurate Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlwaysAccurateAttack): He has maximum accuracy with every model of the gunblade, to the point that he's functionally immune to [Blind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatusEffects). Squall just deals less damage instead of missing more often.

[Always Save the Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlwaysSaveTheGirl):
QUOTE **Squall:** "Rinoa... Even if you end up as the world's enemy, I'll... I'll be your knight."

[Animal Motifs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimalMotifs): Lions. He sees them as a symbol of pride and strength. This is why he always carries Griever around with him. He also has the symbol of a lion on his keychain and his jacket.

[Asskicking Leads to Leadership](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AsskickingLeadsToLeadership): Cid steps down as Headmaster and promotes him to Commander of SeeD specifically in order to change Garden from a school to an active fighting force against the sorceress. The decision is undoubtedly helped along by the fact that Cid already knows, courtesy of Edea, [that Squall is going to defeat Ultimecia in the future](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StableTimeLoop).

[Badass Boast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBoast): Squall asks Rinoa's father, a big-name General for one of the most powerful nations in the world, not to interfere with Squall's group's contractual obligations to Rinoa and her resistance movement. When said general asks what Squall and company will do if he does, Squall utters just two phrases in complete calm: "We're all SeeDs here. We'll act accordingly". Cue all of his comrades behind him standing up straight in defiance, until Irvine manages to break the tension.

[Badass Driver](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassDriver): Squall hijacks a top-down car during the disc one finale and speeds up to square-off against his [Rival Turned Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RivalTurnedEvil) and the (literal) [Disc-One Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiscOneFinalBoss).

[Because Destiny Says So](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BecauseDestinySaysSo): Cid uses this reasoning (vis-a-vis a [Stable Time Loop](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StableTimeLoop)) for appointing Squall commander of Garden, despite the fact that Squall was a cadet a very short time ago and there are far more experienced SeeDs in Garden.

[Beneath the Mask](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BeneathTheMask): His "cold, unfriendly loner" persona is a mask he developed as a child in order to  (SPOILER) deal with the pain of losing his "sister" Ellone . If you look at his entire persona, it's very much like how a child would think a "tough adult" would act; beneath it, he is insecure and emotionally immature, and more caring than he likes to let on.

[BFS](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BFS): Revolver doesn't quite cut it, but the later models, especially the Twin Lance, the Punishment and the Lion Heart, are pretty hefty. [Blasting Zone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WaveMotionSword), his third [Finishing Move](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinishingMove), puts it into a whole new level.

[Big Good](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigGood):  (SPOILER) The [Stable Time Loop](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StableTimeLoop) ensures that Squall will be the legendary SeeD who instilled the idea of SeeD and Garden to Edea.

[Big Man on Campus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigManOnCampus): Much to his own consternation, a lot of the students at Balamb Garden look up to Squall despite his anti-social tendencies. Headmaster Cid recognizes this fact,  (SPOILER) and eventually puts Squall in command.

[Blade Across The Shoulder](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BladeAcrossTheShoulder): His pre-battle and winning animations have him doing this. It becomes his default stance in Dissidia, and the Gunbreaker class in *[Final Fantasy XIV](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyXIV)* inherits this from him as well.

[Blade Spam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BladeSpam): Renzokuken, as its name indicates in Japanese ([It means Continuous Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BilingualBonus)) consists of a string of sword slashes. Especially when [ended](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinishingMove) with Lion Heart, where he slashes the enemy a ton more times.

[Bloodless Carnage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodlessCarnage): After the fight with Edea and Seifer at the end of disc 1, Squall gets hit by an icicle in the shoulder courtesy of Edea. Although it is hard to see a closeup of both his front and back wound, no blood has been spilled on the ground as seen in the overhead shot of Squall falling down. In fact, the next time we see him, the injury is nowhere to be found on him and he seems to have recovered from it just fine.

[Broken Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrokenAce): Much of the student body of Balamb looks up to and admires Squall due to his incredible fighting skills and calm professionalism despite his lone wolf attitude. This tends to confound the emotionally stunted Squall who created his cold-hearted and powerful persona to be strong enough to not have to deal with other people. He mends his breaks and grows into [The Ace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheAce) proper during the game.
[Brutal Honesty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrutalHonesty): He prefers to be blunt and straightforward.

[Cannot Spit It Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CannotSpitItOut): His feelings towards Rinoa. This is because, for the majority of the game, he's simply not emotionally mature enough to *understand* his feelings towards her, or how to reciprocate.

tropeName: Can't Stand Them, Can't Live Without Them
tropeNotes: [Can't Stand Them, Can't Live Without Them](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CannotStandThemCannotLiveWithoutThem): Squall spends the first two discs of the game grimly resisting Rinoa's efforts to get him to open up to her, but gradually giving way. When she falls into a coma at the end of Disc 2, however, he realizes how much he doesn't want to lose her, and she becomes his main priority.

[Celebrity Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CelebrityResemblance): [Intentionally modeled after](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoCelebritiesWereHarmed) actor [River Phoenix](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/RiverPhoenix).

[The Chains of Commanding](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheChainsOfCommanding): It's the reason Squall gets ticked over Cid  (SPOILER) forcing him to lead Balamb Garden . Given that he's barely capable of coping with his own problems, the thought of assuming responsibility for the well-being of others under his command weighs on him almost to the point of paralysis.

[Character Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterCatchphrase): "Whatever." In Japanese, it's "I'm sorry" or "My bad" (悪かった な, *warukatta na*) but done more sarcastically, in the same tone of [Well, Excuse Me, Princess!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WellExcuseMePrincess) note  This is a case of [Lost in Translation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LostInTranslation) rather than mere [Woolseyism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Woolseyism), because he doesn't actually say this as much in Japanese, and a lot of the times he said "Whatever" were actually different defensively snide comments, ranging from "Get off my case", "No big deal", "Oh, geez" to "I don't give a crap" .

[Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment): Goes from a [stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic), aloof and emotionally stunted [Ineffectual Loner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IneffectualLoner), to a reliable commander who stops concealing his [Hidden Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenHeartOfGold).

[Chekhov's Gun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGun): Griever. The game even notes its importance to the plot later on by being one of the few non-Guardian Forces to be [renamable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HelloInsertNameHere).
[Child Soldiers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildSoldiers): He was enrolled at Garden upon its founding, at which time he was no more than five years old.

[Chuunibyou](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Chuunibyou): Downplayed example, as the [Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic) affectations he adopts, do not fall into any of the major subdivisions listed in the trope page, and nobody really accuses him of being childish. But what cannot be denied is that *Squall does not know how to adult*, and his attempts to fake it are fairly transparent.
[Color-Coded for Your Convenience](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColorCodedForYourConvenience): Black to contrast Seifer's white.

[Commanding Coolness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CommandingCoolness): Invoked. When Cid hands leadership of SeeD over to Squall, the position doesn't come with a pre-established rank. His friends discuss it among themselves and rather arbitrarily dub him "Commander," presumably because "Headmaster" no longer accurately reflects the role and "Commander" sounds cooler.

[Consummate Professional](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConsummateProfessional):
    - He flat-out tells Rinoa that his job is to follow her orders, even if she commands them to take on impossible odds and sends them to certain death, because she's the client. His teammates agree with this. Rinoa does not. - The fact that he's paired with a [Ragtag Bunch of Misfits](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RagtagBunchOfMisfits) highlights this even more. The rest of his squad is highly idealistic, while Squall is (or tries to be) more emotionally detached. (SPOILER) One particular scene has the group worrying over Seifer's fate after the latter has fallen into the hands of the sorceress; when Rinoa asks him, he bluntly informs her that it's likely he's already been executed, and that she shouldn't get her hopes up for his survival. - A related scene shortly afterward illustrates how Squall *subverts* this trope when he blows a gasket over the thought of being referred to in the past tense (SPOILER) because everyone is talking about what Seifer *was* like , showing that he's not as "professionally" detached as he wants to be.

[Cool Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolSword): His Gunblade, be it Revolver or the upgrades of it. It looks like a pistol-sized gun with a ginormous blade at the end of it instead of a conventional barrel. The trigger of the gun adds an additional blast to deal more damage upon being hit (featured in-game as an [Action Command](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionCommand) one can do to guarantee a [Critical Hit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CriticalHit)).
[Crash-Into Hello](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrashIntoHello): How he met Selphie. She literally ran straight into him in the second-floor hallway of Balamb Garden.

[Critical Hit Class](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CriticalHitClass): In a way. Squall can't critical hit naturally, as instead his critical hits are tied to the trigger mechanic. Once a player has mastered the timing on the trigger, most of Squall's attacks will critical hit.

[Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil): Played very, very straight; see [Color-Coded for Your Convenience](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColorCodedForYourConvenience). Cold and aloof though he may be, he's nonetheless a hero wearing all black.
[Defrosting Ice King](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefrostingIceKing): Much of the game is spent with the other cast members holding a blowtorch to his frosty attitude.

[Determinator](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Determinator): Pretty much the entire third disc involves Squall turning into one of these to heal Rinoa. And then there's that time he jumps down *several stories* in order to save Zell.
[Diagonal Cut](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DiagonalCut): The last cut of his most powerful finisher, the Lion Heart, is this.

[Didn't Think This Through](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidntThinkThisThrough): Squall gets into a spacesuit and leaves the [Escape Pod](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EscapePod) to  (SPOILER) rescue Rinoa, who's floating out in space . Even though he succeeds, they're both stuck out in the middle of space, low on oxygen, and with no way to get back to the Planet. Fortunately, [Deus ex machina](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeusExMachina) saves the day.

[Dueling Scar](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DuelingScar): He receives a scar over his face from dueling with his nemesis (who receives a matching but flipped scar, making their scars a literal case of "Dueling Scars").

[Dynamic Entry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DynamicEntry): Squall makes a couple of impressive gunblade-first leaping entrances. In the D-District Prison,  (SPOILER) he saves Zell by leaping a half a dozen stories onto a prison guard about to shoot him.

tropeName: Elegant Weapon for a More Civilized Age
tropeNotes: [Elegant Weapon for a More Civilized Age](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ElegantWeaponForAMoreCivilizedAge): His weapon is a gunblade, a weapon said to be very hard to master.
[Ensign Newbie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnsignNewbie): Fresh off his graduation, he's put in charge of a field team and sent off on a mission.

[Everyone Can See It](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EveryoneCanSeeIt): Interestingly, even Squall can see that everyone can see it, but he doesn't [realize](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveEpiphany) how much he loves Rinoa until  (SPOILER) she becomes a Sorceress and goes comatose.

[Exotic Weapon Supremacy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExoticWeaponSupremacy): Gunblade users are talked up as being super-fighters simply due to how [Difficult, but Awesome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DifficultButAwesome) controlling Gunblades tend to be.

[Facepalm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Facepalm): He's known for doing this in reaction to what others have said or done so often, he even does this within *[Kingdom Hearts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/KingdomHearts)*.

[First-Person Smartass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FirstPersonSmartass): He does an [Inner Monologue](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InnerMonologue) far more than the other characters do, some of which borderline on snarking. At one point, he even snarks at his own reaction to something.
[Genius Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GeniusBruiser): In addition to being the most powerful SeeD cadet, he has a keen mind and proves a competent, strategic leader.
[Good Is Not Nice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodIsNotNice): He's pretty harsh on Rinoa and the Timber Owls, but his points are valid. There's also the fact that he's a mercenary to start with.
[Good Scars, Evil Scars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodScarsEvilScars): He acquires his Hero Scar during the opening FMV. The Garden nurse says that it likely won't fade for quite a long time.
[Grey-and-Gray Morality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GreyAndGrayMorality): In his own words, there are no true Good or Evil, just people with opposing viewpoints.

[Handshake Refusal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HandshakeRefusal): A running gag early on in the game is that Squall refuses to shake *anybody's* hand, no matter what the circumstance is. This is significant because the first telltale sign that he subconsciously sees Rinoa differently from other people is that he *accepts her handshake* during formal introductions.
[Hates Being Touched](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HatesBeingTouched): Downplayed. Squall just says he's not used to it when Rinoa is sitting in his lap and has her arms wrapped around him.

[Hates Small Talk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HatesSmallTalk): When badgered by his companions to speak, you can visually see his whole body sigh before he stands upright to make as short a statement as possible. Squall is a [Terse Talker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TerseTalker) even after character development, only saying as much as he absolutely needs to, and only when he has to.
[He Knows About Timed Hits](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeKnowsAboutTimedHits): Pressing R1 at the right time will cause Squall's basic attack to critically hit automatically.
[Hereditary Hairstyle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HereditaryHairstyle):  (SPOILER) He has his mother's dark brown hair.

[The Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHero): Although he's rather [anti heroic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiHero) one, at least at first, Squall is the main protagonist of the game and the one who goes through the most [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment).
[Heroes Prefer Swords](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroesPreferSwords): Or Gunblades, in this instance.

[Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD): Several, thanks to his severe emotional damage.
    - After Seifer's apparent death, he freaks out when the rest of the team starts talking about him in the past tense, realizing that someday people might be talking about *himself* that way. - When he first meets Ellone in the present and finds out that it's her that sends him and the other to the minds of Laguna, Kiros, and Ward, he has a massive freak out at her and then immediately resorts to collapsing on a chair and going completely silent. - He has a lot of trouble maintaining a leaderish mindset during Rinoa's coma. Specifically, he walks out of Garden with her on his back without telling anyone, deciding to find Ellone by himself. - An *epic* one in the end. (SPOILER) His head basically breaks and he winds up in a barren desert created by his mental reaction to Time Compression, from which Rinoa rescues him.

[Heroic Self-Deprecation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicSelfDeprecation): He proves to be *massively* insecure. It's one of the main reasons for his jerkass behavior — by putting up a tough, unfriendly facade he can hold others at arm's length and control how they perceive him, rather than let them see his true weaknesses and anxieties and risk being looked down on or rejected as a result.

[Hidden Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenHeartOfGold): Squall is perfectly aware he comes off as cold, unfriendly, and professional. He acts this way on purpose to keep from getting close to people because he doesn't want to have to experience the pain of losing them as he did with  (SPOILER) Ellone . In his (initial) opinion, being alone makes life easier for him as opposed to relying on others.
[Hope Is Scary](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HopeIsScary): He believes he'll feel less pain if he doesn't get his hopes up. Rinoa drags him out of this mindset.

[I Can't Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ICantDance): In the ballroom scene, he insists to Rinoa that he can't dance. Turns out to be a lie, at least once Rinoa gets him to loosen up a little; he later confirms that SeeD trainees are taught formal ballroom dancing as a potential cover skill.

[I Hate Past Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IHatePastMe): Witnessing a [Pensieve Flashback](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PensieveFlashback) of himself as a child crying over Ellone's disappearance, he describes it as a "disgraceful sight."
[I Work Alone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IWorkAlone): Squall continues to try and pull this, but to his own consternation, constantly gets put into more and more leadership roles.

[Iconic Starter Equipment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IconicStarterEquipment): His basic gunblade, the Revolver, is his trademark weapon and is the default for his appearances in side media and related content.
[Impaled with Extreme Prejudice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpaledWithExtremePrejudice): At the end of Disc 1 when Edea launches an ice crystal straight through his chest. He got better.
[Impossibly Cool Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpossiblyCoolWeapon): Gunblades like these are almost impossible to replicate in real life, let alone use effectively.

[Improbable Weapon User](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableWeaponUser): It is said in-game that the weapon he wields is a hard one to master. Several characters comment on the extreme difficulty of gunblades and how Squall and Seifer are the only two people willing to wield them.
[Ineffectual Loner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IneffectualLoner): A protagonist version. He didn't want to be the hero, anyways. He [grows out of it](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment).

[Informed Attribute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InformedAttribute): Squall is spoken of as one of the most famous students at Balamb Garden that other students admire. However, most of the other Garden students the player interacts with show no such admiration, and given Squall's anti-social attitudes it's questionable why they would look up to him, which is something Squall himself has difficulty understanding since he constantly tries to push others away.
[Inner Monologue](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InnerMonologue): Squall does more of this than he does actual talking. A source of humor with pretty much anyone who gets to know him.

[Ironic Echo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IronicEcho): Near the beginning of the game, he tells Quistis that he's not interested in listening to her and tells her to go talk to a wall. Half a game later,  (SPOILER) after Rinoa falls into a coma, Squall realizes he loves her and begs her to talk to him. Frustrated by her silence, he notes it's like talking to a wall.

[It's Personal with the Dragon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsPersonalWithTheDragon): Squall has a much bigger bone to pick with [Seifer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RivalTurnedEvil) than with [Ultimecia](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad).

[Kick the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KickTheDog): Sometimes, he goes a bit *too* far with his [facade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenHeartOfGold); such as the infamous scene where Rinoa storms out of an argument calling him a "meanie".
[Knight in Sour Armor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KnightInSourArmor): He's a pretty cynical guy, but for all that commits himself to the idealistic Rinoa.

[Lady and Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LadyAndKnight):  (SPOILER) Vows to become Rinoa's knight in Disc 3. Whether he's the Bright or Dark variety is irrelevant to him. All that matters is Rinoa's safety.
[The Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLeader): Assigned as such to a SeeD mission to help Rinoa's resistance group.  (SPOILER) He is later promoted to the leader of Balamb Garden.
[Lightning Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightningBruiser): Squall has the highest HP and vitality among the six main characters, and is quite fast too.
[Loners Are Freaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LonersAreFreaks): He catches this kind of attitude from many other characters in the game.
[Love Epiphany](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveEpiphany):  (SPOILER) Squall realizes his feelings for Rinoa after her comatose in Disc 3.

[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): Though *VIII* and several other *Final Fantasy* games have no job system, remnants of gameplay mechanics or story always hint at them. In Squall's case, he's a Magic Knight or Spellblade, since his Limit Break finishers always have him infusing his blade with powerful energy, a hallmark of the job class. He gets classified as this in *Final Fantasy Record Keeper*, as well.

[Master Swordsman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterSwordsman): Referred to by Headmaster Cid as a "Gunblade Specialist", as they are his weapon of choice. A "Gunblade" being a notoriously difficult weapon to Master, only Squall and Seifer are capable of wielding them, and Squall is widely considered the most formidable warrior at SeeD. SeeDs, in and of themselves are considered to be the elite, the best operatives in the world. You do the math.
[Meaningful Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeaningfulName): "Squall," as in a violent storm, and of course "lionheart."

[Mix-and-Match Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MixAndMatchWeapon): The difficult to master Gunblade. Notorious because he and Seifer are the only ones capable of using them effectively. His Revolver Gunblade has become iconic.

[Named Weapons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NamedWeapons): His gunblades are called, from weakest to strongest, Revolver, Sheer Trigger, Cutting Trigger, Flame Saber, Twin Lance, Punishment, and [Lion Heart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InfinityPlusOneSword).

[Never Be Hurt Again](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverBeHurtAgain): The reason for his cold, detached demeanor is because  (SPOILER) his fellow orphan and sister, Ellone, left him alone as a child and he developed abandonment issues. He feels that, eventually, all friends and family die or go away, and the only way to avoid the pain from that is to never let anyone in again.

[New Child Left Behind](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NewChildLeftBehind): His mother [died at birth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathByChildBirth), and his father  (SPOILER) didn't learn about him until much later .

[Nice Job Breaking It, Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceJobBreakingItHero): Squall's efforts to  (SPOILER) revive Rinoa from a coma over the course of Disc 3  end up playing into the [Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad)'s hands, as  (SPOILER) Ultimecia, controlling Rinoa, releases Adel from imprisonment as her stasis pod is dragged out of orbit by the Lunar Cry.
[No Social Skills](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoSocialSkills): Enrolling at Garden at approximately the age of five did a hell of a number on Squall's social aptitude.

[Not So Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotSoStoic): His stoicism increasingly breaks down as his coping mechanisms are tested and proven wanting. Disc 3 provides the best example, but instances occur as early as Disc 1, starting with the mini-meltdown he has over the way people talk about Seifer after his supposed death.
[Official Couple](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OfficialCouple): He and Rinoa. Heck, they're the logo.
[Opposites Attract](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OppositesAttract): His introverted personality and Rinoa's extroverted one.

[Parental Abandonment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalAbandonment):  (SPOILER) His mother [died giving birth to him](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathByChildbirth). His father, on the other hand, was away during the pregnancy to rescue his kidnapped older sister on the other side of the world and was immediately elected as that nation's president following his successful ousting of its dictator.

[Pet the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PetTheDog): He's consistently not-mean to Selphie, generally letting her have her way with things. Indeed, if you decide to play along in front of her friend at Trabia, he tells her Selphie's been a great help, which causes her to teasingly remark that it's not like him all to say that.

[Pinball Protagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PinballProtagonist): For a good part of the game, he's mostly passive, simply carried from mission to mission as part of his job. A lot of political events go on in the background, but unlike the typical save-the-world do-gooder hero, he and the rest of the party don't have an impact on them (e.g. Timber's resistance plot fails, but they move on anyway because they completed their mission). Early Disc 2 shows a distinct contrast in Selphie being proactive in trying to stop a missile launch while Squall just goes back to Garden under her orders. Eventually, he gets fed up with being this, complaining he feels like a helpless puppet. Disc 3 is when he finally does something of his own volition and tries to get Rinoa medical help in Esthar.
[Pretty Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrettyBoy): He's explicitly called "the best looking guy here" by Rinoa at the SeeD ball and his facial scar does little to detract from his good looks.

[The Proud Elite](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheProudElite): He is a tall, dark, handsome, proud, [stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic), quietly dismissive [Jerkass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Jerkass) (although he has a compelling [Freudian Excuse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FreudianExcuse)). When it comes to [Rinoa](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LoveInterests), however, he gets all squishy and emotional. And when he finds out his [True Companions](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueCompanions) are [Not Quite Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotQuiteDead), he's visibly pleased.

[The Quiet One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheQuietOne): Even after most of his [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment) takes place, he's still not the stereotypical loud teenage JRPG hero.

["The Reason You Suck" Speech](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReasonYouSuckSpeech): When Rinoa demands his opinion on the Forest Owls, Squall gives it. They're amateurish, don't think through the consequences of their plans, and neither their skills nor their attitude inspires any confidence in him or his team.
[Red Oni, Blue Oni](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedOniBlueOni): Blue Oni to Seifer's Red Oni.

[The Reliable One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReliableOne): Squall may not be interested in making friends, but he follows orders, takes his responsibilities seriously, and always gets the job done. In fact, close inspection of the text shows that however much he may complain, Squall consistently does just about everything anyone asks him to do over the course of the story. Despite his prickly and anti-social behavior, his considerable skills and his reliability on the job earned him a lot of respect from his peers at Garden, and this has a lot to do with why he keeps getting thrust into more and more leadership roles despite how little he wants to be in charge of anything.
[Resigned to the Call](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ResignedToTheCall): [Until Disc 3, anyway.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment)

[Revolvers Are Just Better](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RevolversAreJustBetter): His default Gunblade, as the name indicates, has a revolver handle, contrasting Seifer's, which resembles a semi-automatic.
    - He, however also subverts this. Whilst the most famous Gunblade is his initial Revolver, his upgrades follow a pattern: First, he changes the blade to a more powerful one, then he changes the handle to one resembling a semi-automatic pistol. Whilst Cutting Trigger and Twinlance use the silver Revolver handle, the Shear Trigger, Flame Saber, and the Punisher (which are more powerful versions of the Revolver, Cutting Trigger, and Twinlance, respectively) use the black semi-auto handle. The Lion Heart, the most powerful Gunblade of all, does away with it all and instead uses something resembling an Assault Rifle for its handle. It even comes equipped with fire selectors like assault rifles and sub-machine guns do.
[Rousing Speech](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RousingSpeech): Gives one to motivate his troops during the [Battle of the Gardens](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBadassBattleSequence).

[Savvy Guy, Energetic Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SavvyGuyEnergeticGirl): The savvy guy to Rinoa's energetic girl. He's a lot more pragmatic, experienced and aloof, while she's more green, energetic and cheerful.

[She Is Not My Girlfriend](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SheIsNotMyGirlfriend): While in the infirmary when Squall gives Rinoa a tour of Balamb Garden, Dr. Kadowaki asks if Rinoa is Squall's girlfriend. The player is given the option several times of having Squall either confirm or deny it.

[Shout-Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOut): If you haven't figured it out by now, the Gunblades are these to *[Star Wars](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/StarWars)*. The [Infinity +1 Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InfinityPlusOneSword) "Lion Heart" even looks like a [lightsaber](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaserBlade).
[Significant Birthdate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SignificantBirthdate): Squall shares his birthday with River Phoenix (August 23), on whom his design was based.

[Somebody Else's Problem](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SomebodyElsesProblem): When Seifer shows up on TV to capture President Deling, Squall quickly decides not to get involved because it has nothing to do with their mission—until Quistis gets in front of the camera to specifically ask for their help, so he has to.

[Sour Outside, Sad Inside](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SourOutsideSadInside): He actively presents himself as surly and unsympathetic to keep others from getting close, while inwardly he's deeply insecure, longing for support from others but desperately afraid of the pain that would come from losing them.

[Spam Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpamAttack): His Renzokuken [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), which actually translates to "continuous sword". His ultimate [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak), Lion Heart, takes this further.

[Spell Blade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpellBlade): *Final Fantasy VIII* has no job classes at all, but they are hinted through stats, weapons, and Limit Breaks. Squall is typically considered to be a Fighter/Warrior, but his ability to infuse his Gunblade with various types of energy for his Limit Break typically makes him be considered a Spell Blade or Mystic Knight in games such as *Final Fantasy Record Keeper*.
[Spin Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpinAttack): His Fated Circle [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak). He spins, causing a giant shockwave that shreds the enemies.

[Stab the Sky](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StabTheSky): The pose he strikes in order to perform his Blasting Zone Limit Break. He LITERALLY stabs the sky with the gigantic blade beam that surpasses even the atmosphere.
[Stepford Snarker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StepfordSnarker): He explains his neuroses to Rinoa and finishes by saying "Don't tell anyone I said that." While she is in a *coma*.

[The Stoic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStoic): It's interesting to note that the exact qualities that make him a good soldier (quiet, emotionless, obedient) make him a poor human being because he forced himself to become an adult  (SPOILER) as a child to cope with the loss of Ellone . Contrast this with Laguna, who is both a competent soldier *and* a complete dork because he matured at a natural pace.

[The Strategist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStrategist): He spends the entire Battle of the Gardens turning a desperate fight against superior enemies in both numbers and weapons into an even match, eventually turning the tides.
[Strong Family Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongFamilyResemblance):  (SPOILER) Most of his physical traits come from his mother.

[Sugar-and-Ice Personality](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SugarAndIcePersonality): Ice mostly, until [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment) sets in. Even then, he could still easily be seen as a bit distant since he's [The Quiet One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheQuietOne).

[Surrounded by Idiots](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SurroundedByIdiots): Squall behaves this way through the first disc or so. In his defense, by the end of Disc 1 every single one of Squall's comrades makes at least one very poor decision that needlessly endangers themselves, others, or the mission. Squall himself has to bail them out on multiple occasions.

[Sword Beam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordBeam): His Blasting Zone and Fated Circle [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) both unleash huge amounts of [energy waves](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KiManipulation) to hit multiple opponents.

[Sword Drag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordDrag): His first finisher, the Rough Divide, has him doing this before slashing his opponent bottom to top. It can more clearly be seen during the introductory cutscene, it is the attack he performs to scar Seifer.
[Sword Lines](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwordLines): During his Limit Break "Renzokuken", whatever gunblade Squall happens to be wielding gets the second type.
[Tall, Dark, and Handsome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TallDarkAndHandsome): Well, average height at 172cm (roughly 5'8"). The *Ultimania* has amended his height to 177cm (roughly 5'10").
[Tall, Dark, and Snarky](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TallDarkAndSnarky): In addition to being tall and dark-haired, he also doesn't hesitate to snark when people get on his nerves.

[Team Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamDad): Much to his own annoyance. He tends to become a [Papa Wolf](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PapaWolf) with his friends, [not that he cares to admit it.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenHeartOfGold)

[Technicolor Blade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TechnicolorBlade): The Cutting Trigger and Flame Saber Gunblades have a bright Red blade, whereas his most powerful weapon, the Lion Heart, has a blade that goes from white-hot to deep blue in a gradient.

[That Makes Me Feel Angry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThatMakesMeFeelAngry): Part of his problem with relating to others is that he *won't* engage in this. In Cid's office in Balamb Garden, when Squall asks him to handle what he's planning to rescue Balamb Garden from being hit by missiles, Cid asks him why he wants to do it. The player alone is privy to Squall's inner monologue ticking off at least five specific reasons why he wants to take on the mission before he finally lands on, "I don't know why... Who cares?" and tells Cid, "My feelings have nothing to do with it, sir." Later in the game, Rinoa has to tell him flat-out that she and the others won't understand how he's feeling if he doesn't tell them.

[Took a Level in Idealism](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInIdealism): Squall's [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment) throughout the game is to learn how to connect with other people and how not to shut yourself to the world if things don't turn out the way you hoped to.

[Too Many Belts](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TooManyBelts): Six to be specific.  <sup>note </sup>  One regular, two crossed in the waist, and three mini-belts in his right thigh.  It goes to even greater lengths in his appearances in other games. In *Kingdom Hearts*, for example, he uses several belts around his forearm!

[Troubled, but Cute](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TroubledButCute): Despite his cold exterior, Rinoa finds him cute and endearing, and frequently teases him about it. It's also mentioned by [Yuffie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII) in *Kingdom Hearts*.
[Tyke-Bomb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Tykebomb): All SeeD are this to an extent, but Squall is a standout case  (SPOILER) being the focus of the stable time loop .
[Unbroken Vigil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnbrokenVigil): Squall to Rinoa, after Rinoa falls into her coma. He takes the vigil on the move when he decides to take Rinoa to Esthar in search of Ellone.

[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): Even though he started off distant from everyone, after [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment) became completely devoted to Rinoa. Even stating that even if she becomes a witch against the rest of the world, he'd be her knight.
[Uptight Loves Wild](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UptightLovesWild): The source of his growing attraction to Rinoa.

[Vibroweapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Vibroweapon): How gunblades work according to the *Ultimania* guide. Pulling the trigger sends a shockwave through the blade, and timing this right allows Squall to deal a lot of damage in gameplay.
[Visible Silence](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VisibleSilence): He's fond of giving these when he has nothing to respond or simply doesn't feel like responding.
[Wacky Parent, Serious Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WackyParentSeriousChild):  (SPOILER) Squall is stoic, brooding and professional, while his father is a proud dork.

[Warrior Prince](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WarriorPrince):  (SPOILER) Unbeknownst to Squall, his [Disappeared Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisappearedDad) has been the President of Esthar for much of his life. By the time they finally meet in person, Squall is already an accomplished warrior leading his own team.

[What the Hell, Hero?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatTheHellHero): When the rest of his party members learn that Squall let Rinoa go with Esthar officials to be cryogenically frozen, they all furiously call him out for just letting Rinoa go after all he did to save her.

[When He Smiles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenHeSmiles): In the game's [Stinger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stinger), we finally see Squall smile for Rinoa, [and it is gorgeous.](http://i21.photobucket.com/albums/b283/seifer04/squallsmile.jpg)◊

[World's Best Warrior](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorldsBestWarrior): SeeD is considered an elite force with unsurpassed operatives. Squall is recognized as the greatest SeeD by the end of the game, what with  (SPOILER) being the Legendary SeeD and all .

[You Are in Command Now](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreInCommandNow): But he doesn't want it, and doesn't enjoy it. Even though he does well in it. Starts with him being in command of his SeeD and then eventually Balamb Garden as a whole.

[Abnormal Ammo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbnormalAmmo): Another fairly unique weapon, Rinoa uses a type of weapon called Blaster Edge, which fires an [Absurdly Sharp Blade](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AbsurdlySharpBlade) from her wrist-mounted launching device. Most models resemble discs, but the Pinwheel and Cardinal look like birds or boomerangs, and the Valkyrie is basically a small, flying sword.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): Although she's less experienced story-wise, she does have a pretty good strength stat.
[Attack Animal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AttackAnimal): Angelo. Her first set of Limit Breaks involve her helping Rinoa do combination attacks.
[Badass Adorable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassAdorable): She's a really cute young lady, and more than capable in battle.
[Barely-Changed Dub Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BarelyChangedDubName): She was renamed "Linoa" in the French version.

[Battle Boomerang](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BattleBoomerang): Fired from a wrist mounted launcher. Often they overlap with [Rings of Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RingsOfDeath) or [Deadly Disc](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeadlyDisc).
[The Beastmaster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBeastmaster): Quite funny when you consider she also tames a certain lion throughout the game.
[Big Friendly Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigFriendlyDog): Her dog Angelo.

[Black Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackMage): Though there is no job system per se in *VIII*, through their special attributes characters have a hint of this. Though Rinoa's first limit break uses her dog Angelo to attack like a Trainer would, and she uses traditionally Ninja weapons, as a unit whose second limit break has her casting exclusively black magic spells, she ends up as this. It also helps that she eventually  (SPOILER) becomes a Sorceress in-game.
[Black Magician Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackMagicianGirl): If her high magic stats don't count her as one initially,  (SPOILER) she definitely becomes one upon becoming a Sorceress .
[Blue Is Heroic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlueIsHeroic): Rinoa wears a blue vest and is one of the good guys.
[Canine Companion](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanineCompanion): Her [Big Friendly Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigFriendlyDog) Angelo.

[Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment): At the start of the storyline, she's a well-meaning but spoiled and naive rich girl, whose idealism and enthusiasm override good sense, leading to her making hasty, ill-thought-out plans. After several disastrous results and spending time around Squall's team, she begins to understand just how out of her depth she really is, culminating in her becoming a more effective member of the team who makes carefully-considered decisions by the third disc, including the calm-yet-terrifying choice to surrender to Esthar so that they can seal her away and prevent her from being possessed again. Her dialogue also becomes notably less childish and more mature over the course of the game, especially after she recovers from her coma.

[Character Tic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterTic): Rinoa and her cute "pointing towards the sky" gesture are synonymous with each other. Whenever Rinoa makes an appearance in other media, official or fanmade, she is very likely to strike this pose. She is also known to cutesy gestures like hugging her knees or dangling her feet whilst sitting.
[Combination Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombinationAttack): Her [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) with Angelo which aptly fall under the name Combine.
[Convenient Coma](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConvenientComa): At the end of Disc 2 until the first half of Disc 3.  (SPOILER)  Caused and used by Ultimecia.
[Cosmic Motifs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CosmicMotifs): Aside from angels, she is also associated with shooting stars.
[Coy, Girlish Flirt Pose](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoyGirlishFlirtPose): She does this a lot when talking to Squall, starting in the ballroom sequence.
[Cute Bookworm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CuteBookworm): She's delighted when she first sees Garden's library, and can always be found reading there when not in the active party.
[The Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCutie): Designed by [Tetsuya Nomura](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/TetsuyaNomura) to be cute rather than gorgeous.

[Damsel in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamselInDistress): [Justified](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JustifiedTrope) as, unlike the other playable characters, who are [Child Soldiers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildSoldiers), she lived a comfortable upper-class life with no background of combat training. Rinoa requires rescuing four times over the course of the game note  once each in the first and second discs, twice in Disc 3 and is unplayable for a good amount of the third disc thanks to being variously comatose, possessed by Ultimecia, or imprisoned by Esthar. That said, only the first time was result of a [Distress Ball](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DistressBall) and, gameplay-wise, she [Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass) by becoming a Sorceress.
    - Unintentionally Exploited during Rinoa's last distress situation. (SPOILER) While she is kidnapped by Seifer and taken to Adel, it's important to remember that Seifer inadvertently played right into the protagonists' hands by hooking Rinoa up to the Sorceress, since the plan was for Rinoa to absorb her powers upon Adel's defeat.

[Didn't Think This Through](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidntThinkThisThrough): While she's well-intentioned, she doesn't fully grasp the seriousness of the situations she's involved in, or the consequences her actions will have for others. She's fond of coming up with big plans but doesn't consider what will happen if they fail *or* if they succeed—they hijack the train car but she clearly doesn't have any idea what to do with "Deling" once they do. Part of her [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment) is outgrowing this.

[The Face](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheFace): Rinoa is quite good at social situations, since she is able to persuade Cid to loan out SeeD within one meeting, and helps bring Squall out of his shell. This likely factors into her decision to try and get Edea to put the Odine Bangle on.

[Feather Motif](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FeatherMotif): Beginning with her turning a flower petal into a feather in the opening sequence. Her limit break Angel Wing and her [Infinity Plus One Blaster Edge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InfinityPlusOneSword) also share an angel wing/feather theme. And her duster sweater has a pair of angel wings on the back.

[Foreshadowing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foreshadowing): The player gets a strong hint about where Rinoa is actually from when the party gets to Galbadia and she tells them how to navigate the city's bus system.
[Gender-Blender Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenderBlenderName): Not Rinoa herself, but Angelo is [actually a female dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YourTomcatIsPregnant).

[Guile Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuileHero): A subtle, mostly non-manipulative example. Rinoa is very adept in social situations, reading people, and figuring them out. She's able to motivate, lead, and inspire intense loyalty in a resistance movement, hobnob at a fancy dress party, and when it comes to it, manipulating people into helping her. The fact that she's able to force Squall out of his shell in such a short time (compared with Quistis, who was trying for years to get him to open up) is remarked upon.
[Heroes Love Dogs](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroesLoveDogs): And so do [heroines](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenderFlip)!

[Honorary Princess](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HonoraryPrincess): Rinoa is not a princess, but the resistance calls her that as a nickname, most likely because she's the daughter of the occupying state's military commander.
[Human Shield](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanShield): Used as one by Adel during a boss fight.

[Impossibly Cool Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpossiblyCoolWeapon): Her Blaster Edge weapons. No one discusses how insane they are, or how would anyone avoid being cut by the very same sharp projectile you just used to dispatch your enemies. Apparently, Blaster Edges can fire anything from the wrist-mounted launching device, seeing as how Rinoa also uses to hurl her dog at opponents.

[Improbable Weapon User](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImprobableWeaponUser): The "blaster edge", a chakram-like weapon she fires from a wrist-mounted launcher, which returns like a [Precision-Guided Boomerang](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrecisionGuidedBoomerang). She launches her *dog* from it in one of her [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak).
[Last Girl Wins](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LastGirlWins): Rinoa is the last female to (permanently) join the team and the one Squall falls in love with.
[Literal Cliff Hanger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LiteralCliffHanger): Off the side of Balamb Garden during the Battle of the Gardens.

[The Load](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLoad): For the first two discs, every plan Rinoa comes up with goes badly, and she very frequently has to be rescued. She grows out of it in the second half of Disc 3, but still finds time to get abducted one more time.  (SPOILER) Because this time, the heroes *want* her to be captured.
[Magic Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight): Very strong with both magic and physical strength.

[Manic Pixie Dream Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManicPixieDreamGirl): Subverted. She acts like it around Squall in Disc 1 — and gets told off for it. She shapes up in Disc 2 after nearly getting killed by Edea. Played more straight in the emotional aspects when her persistence in getting to know Squall and for him to open up and rely on her initiates his [Character Development](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment).
[The McCoy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMcCoy): She's highly critical of Squall's coldness towards his teammates.
[Military Brat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MilitaryBrat): She has the distant father, although not the uprooted lifestyle since he's a general rather than a grunt.
[Missing Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MissingMom): Her mother died in a car accident.

[Muscles Are Meaningless](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MusclesAreMeaningless): At level 100, the playable character with the highest unmodified strength stat in the game isn't Squall, Seifer, or Ward. It's Rinoa. This is most likely a case of [Gameplay and Story Segregation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation); due to being unavailable for an extended period, Rinoa misses out on stat-boosting opportunities that the rest of the party is able to take advantage of, and thus has better-than-average natural stat growth in order to prevent a case of [Can't Catch Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CantCatchUp).

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): To the Ranger class and a [Shout-Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOut) to [Forest Ranger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ForestRanger): She's a crossbow(-of sorts)-using fighter who fights with a dog and lives in a city built in the middle of a giant forest.

[Nom de Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NomDeMom): Properly, her name ought to be Rinoa *Caraway* thanks to her dad. Rinoa goes by her mother Julia's surname, either as a form of protest against her father or just because being obviously related to a Galbadian general would hurt her credibility with the various factions of the Timber resistance.
[Non-Human Sidekick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonHumanSidekick): Her dog Angelo, who helps her in her [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak).

[Not a Game](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotAGame): Rinoa gets this lecture by Quistis, who shoot Rinoa down after hearing her plan to use the Odine's Bracelet.
QUOTE **Rinoa:** *[to herself]* I'm not a SeeD, but... I can do this... This isn't some kind of game...

[Not What It Looks Like](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotWhatItLooksLike): Rinoa claims she doesn't want to ask Squall to see his ring (so Zell can make a replica of it) because people would get the wrong idea.
[Official Couple](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OfficialCouple): She and Squall, who are so official they are the trope picture.
[Opposites Attract](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OppositesAttract): She and Squall.

[Overshadowed by Awesome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OvershadowedByAwesome): For someone without military training, Rinoa has a few shinning moments in Disc 1, like [running on top of a moving train](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrainTopBattle) or infiltrate the Sorceress quarters in Galbadia by herself, but her plans fails and, compared to the SeeD members, she is just an amateur.
[Plucky Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PluckyGirl): Although she openly admits her fear of fighting alone, she still manages to stand toe-to-toe with the trained mercenaries.

[Power Gives You Wings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerGivesYouWings): Gain angel wings whe nactivating her "Angel Wing" [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak). Also, the Valkyrie and Cardinal are wrist mounted [Automatic Crossbows](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AutomaticCrossbows).
[Quizzical Tilt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/QuizzicalTilt): Her standard pose whenever she's not moving has her tilt her head a bit to the side. It helps emphasize her curious and naive nature.
[Raven Hair, Ivory Skin](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RavenHairIvorySkin): The heroine with the palest skin and darkest hair of the three women.
[Rebel Leader](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RebelLeader): She leads the Forest Owls, the only active resistance group in Timber.

[Rebellious Princess](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RebelliousPrincess): At least stylistically. She's not an actual princess, but the Forest Owls call her that. Rinoa grew up in the lap of luxury and is clearly used to getting her way, but despite her naivete she's very socially-conscious, compassionate, and highly motivated to help people in need. She's more than willing to leave the comfort of her father's Deling City mansion to get her hands dirty helping a resistance faction fight the oppressive Galbadian occupation of Timber, and is the main driving force behind the Forest Owls.

[Rich Kid Turned Social Activist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RichKidTurnedSocialActivist): Her late mother was a famous singer and her father is a Galbadian general. Her father's home in Deling City turns out to be a luxurious mansion, but despite her privileged upbringing Rinoa is very aware of what's going on in the world around her and chooses to fight her own country's occupation of Timber.

[Ring on a Necklace](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RingOnANecklace): She keeps the wedding ring of her deceased mother around a chain. Later on she also gains one of Squall Leonhart's own rings, <sup>note </sup>  She was actually going to make a copy of it, but she ended up in a coma before she could.  signifying they were becoming that much closer.
[Savvy Guy, Energetic Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SavvyGuyEnergeticGirl): She's the energetic girl to Squall's savvy guy.

[Security Cling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecurityCling): Rinoa does this three times to Squall. First, after being rescued from the Iguions, she grabs onto him and doesn't want to let go. Later, while on the Ragnarok, after the intense sequence of events that's just occurred, she takes advantage of the gravity being turned off to float down into Squall's lap and puts her arms around him, telling him that it makes her feel safe. The third time is when she hugs him after he rescues her from the sorceress memorial.
[Significant Birthdate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SignificantBirthdate): Born on March 3rd (Girls Day/Dolls Day in Japan).

[Sixth Ranger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SixthRanger): Played with. She's the only member of the gang who didn't hail from any Garden  (SPOILER) and by extension, the only person in the group who didn't grow up in Edea's orphanage .
[Spam Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpamAttack): Her Wishing Star [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak).

[Spoiled Brat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpoiledBrat): She does things like throw tantrums (which also apparently involves scratching the hell out of whichever unlucky member of [La Résistance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaResistance) has to wake her up from a nap) and *kicking Irvine down the stairs* when he tries to play it cool while rescuing Squall and co. from prison. It's one of the early clues hinting to her affluent background as the daughter of a Galbadian general.
[Strong Family Resemblance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StrongFamilyResemblance): She and her parents all share a [certain physical trait](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RavenHairIvorySkin).

[Summon Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SummonMagic): While all characters have unrestricted access to all summons, of the main party Rinoa has the highest initial compatibility with more than half the available summons, making her the most well suited to act as a summoner off the bat.

[Terrible Artist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TerribleArtist): She painted the presidential car for the Forest Owls' [Model Planning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ModelPlanning) scene, and all members of Squall's team agreed that she did an awful job at it. She tries to play it off as she did it on purpose because it "represents [her] hate towards Deling" to no avail.
[True Blue Femininity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueBlueFemininity): Her coat is blue, and she is the most feminine member of [The Team](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheTeam).
[Two Guys and a Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TwoGuysAndAGirl): This is essentially her dynamic with Squall and Seifer.
[Uptight Loves Wild](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UptightLovesWild): Again, her and Squall. In this case, Rinoa is the first girl to really force herself into Squall's life and get him to open up.
[You Are Not Alone](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreNotAlone): A good deal of her interactions with Squall revolves around getting him to realize this.
[Anime Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnimeHair): Less extreme than [Cloud's](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII), though; it looks like a more plausible application of gel.

[Bare-Fisted Monk](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BareFistedMonk): He's no monk, but he fits the part where he fights with nothing but hands and feet. He'd also fit the Monk class in the franchise. His weapon ends up being pivotal in escaping the D-District Prison, because his combat style isn't dependent on his weaponry.
[Battle Aura](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BattleAura): His Burning Rave and My Final Heaven [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak).
[Big Eater](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigEater): The ending implies this, and you can usually find him loitering in the canteen.

[Big Entrance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigEntrance): Right after Quistis introduces him, he is seen shadow boxing, back flips, and then does an upclose-to-the-screen ["YEAH!" Shot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YeahShot).
[The Big Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBigGuy): Physical powerhouse edition, in spite of being the smallest male party member.
[Boisterous Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoisterousBruiser): He loves fighting and having fun, which sometimes gets on Squall's nerves.

[Bunny-Ears Lawyer](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BunnyEarsLawyer): Despite being a loud, overly energetic nuisance, Zell is not just a meathead. He knows all about the various Odine goods, usually is the one to explain everything and is a reliable second-in-command.

[Butt-Monkey](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ButtMonkey): Almost any time something comically embarrassing happens to one of the playable characters, it's happening to Zell, from being repeatedly snubbed for handshakes to getting "volunteered" to dodge bullets by himself during the D-District Prison sequence to once accidentally crashing into the girl's bathroom using his T-board before the events of the game.

[Character Tic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterTic): Several, from punching the floor to shaking his fists in rage. Zell is... passionate, and it shows through his every motion. However, Zell's most oft-seen tic is his penchant for shadowboxing, and he will do it everywhere and anywhere, something that annoys Seifer (and Squall, a little bit) to no end.

[Chewing the Scenery](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChewingTheScenery): If the game had voice acting, Zell would have been a [Large Ham](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeHam) as evidenced by the text changing pace and switching caps whenever he's amped up.
[Child Soldiers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChildSoldiers): Like the rest of the SeeD cadets. He finishes his training and graduates to active SeeD at the age of seventeen.
[Dark Is Not Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsNotEvil): Although he doesn't wear dominantly black attire as Squall does.
[Drama Queen](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DramaQueen): *Everybody* will know if Zell has an issue with something simply due to how he reacts.

[Early-Bird Cameo](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EarlyBirdCameo): Zell could be spotted twice before his formal introduction. First if the player has Squall log in the Garden database before leaving the classroom right after the opening cutscene where he's seen writing on a forum in Garden Square. Second if Squall goes to the cafeteria before heading to take the Fire cavern exam, in which Zell failed to score his [Trademark Favorite Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrademarkFavoriteFood).
[Facial Markings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FacialMarkings): Has a tattoo on the left side of his face.

[Genius Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GeniusBruiser): As his status as [Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition) and [Mr. Fixit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrFixit) can attest to. He's definitely *not* [Book Dumb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BookDumb), despite early impressions.

[Got Me Doing It](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GotMeDoingIt): Just before fighting Raijin in front of the hotel room, Zell ends up saying Raijin's [signature phrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic) "ya know" at the end of one of his sentences before correcting himself.
[Happily Adopted](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HappilyAdopted): By Ma Dincht. Zell adores her.
[Heroes Fight Barehanded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroesFightBarehanded): Although technically he wears gauntlets.

[A Hero to His Hometown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AHeroToHisHometown): Zell is well-known and quite well-regarded around the town of Balamb, as seen during the Galbadian army occupation sequence in Disc 2. It stands out all the more because up to that point in the story Zell has mostly been depicted as the hotheaded [Butt-Monkey](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ButtMonkey) of the SeeD team, contrasted against Squall's efforts toward professionalism — to the residents of Balamb, however, Squall's just another SeeD, while everyone knows Ma Dincht's boy and are looking to Zell for help in the current crisis.
[Hero Worship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroWorship): He looks up to his grandfather, and was inspired to become a SeeD because he was a soldier.

[Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths): While he acts like a typical [Boisterous Bruiser](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BoisterousBruiser) and [Dumb Muscle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DumbMuscle), he's actually quite smart, adept with machinery, and is one of the most well-informed members of the party. Landing on the Deep Sea Research Center has him explain what they were doing here, causing Squall to admit that he has to rethink his opinion of Zell.
[Hot-Blooded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotBlooded): He's quick to judge and quick to act in most given situations and often loud about it.
[I Know Mortal Kombat](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IKnowMortalKombat): Learns his limit breaks from fighting magazines, which can easily be mistaken for a fan list of attacks from shonen manga and anime.
[Idiot Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IdiotHero): Downplayed. Zell is hyperactive, loud and acts before trinking, but has [Hidden Depths](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HiddenDepths).

[Impaled with Extreme Prejudice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ImpaledWithExtremePrejudice): His Meteor Barret [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) has Zell literally punching his way through his opponents.

[Innocently Insensitive](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InnocentlyInsensitive): When the group decides to go after Ultimecia, Zell proclaims that, as SeeDs, it's their job to destroy the sorceresses, completely forgetting that Rinoa is also a sorceress. He prompty apologizes when Quistis and Squall yell at him.

[Intergenerational Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntergenerationalFriendship): With "Big Bad Rascal", a young [Jerk with a Heart of Gold](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkWithAHeartOfGold) in Balamb, who looks up to him.

[It's All My Fault](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ItsAllMyFault): He has a moment of this after he inadvertently said that Seifer belongs to the Garden right in front of the Galbadian President. It turns out not to matter, mostly because Edea was planning to go to war against Gardens anyway.
[Keet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Keet): Among other things, his character introduction is him backflipping and cartwheeling into the entrance hall.

[Leader Wannabe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeaderWannabe): Zell is always eager to be assigned squad leader. Squall either turns him down (as Gateway team leader in the end of Disc 1) or could reluctantly give him a chance ( (SPOILER) before Squall himself heads to Lunar Base  in Disc 3).
[Maybe Ever After](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaybeEverAfter): The ending cutscene has him eating his favorite food with the Pigtailed Librarian who has a crush on him.

[Meteor Move](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MeteorMove): No, not *Meteor Barrett*, though *Meteor Strike* does count as he lifts the enemy up, before jumping up and doing a mid-air throw down towards the ground. But the crown winner here goes to Zell's *Different Beats* combo finisher, which has him perform a chain of somersault kicks that send both the enemy and himself eventually high into the sky, before performing a fiery diving kick all the way back down to the ground.
[Mr. Exposition](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrExposition): "Thank you very much, Mr. Know-It-All Zell."

[Mr. Fixit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrFixit): Subtly implied in the game that he has a love of machinery, and bringing him to the [Bonus Dungeon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BonusDungeon) makes it easier to complete it because he takes the guessing out of the guessing game.

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): His "Meteor Barret" [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) is a reference to [the previous Final Fantasy game](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII).
[Non-Human Sidekick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonHumanSidekick): Two Dolphins join him in attacking during his Dolphin Blow [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak).

[Noodle Incident](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoodleIncident): Quistis related that there was an incident where Zell crashed his [Cool Board](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolBoard) into the *girls' restroom*. Zell quickly cuts Quistis off before she can tell the rest of the story.
[Number Two](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NumberTwo): Squall can briefly appoint him as a stand-in leader in his absence during Disc 3.
[Oblivious to Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ObliviousToLove): The Pigtailed Librarian has a crush on him but he never seems to pick up on it.

[Percussive Maintenance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PercussiveMaintenance): How he ends up fixing the machine in the [Bonus Dungeon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BonusDungeon). He tries to get it to work, but then resorts to just banging the thing. It's useful to save on pressure points to fight the [Ultima Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperBoss).
[Pint-Sized Powerhouse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PintSizedPowerhouse): Official sources state that Zell is only 5'6" or even 5'5". He is also physically one of the strongest party members.
[Power Fist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerFist): Zell's weapons are fighting gloves, his first being a leather glove with metal plating over the knuckles.

tropeName: Pretty Fly for a White Guy
tropeNotes: [Pretty Fly for a White Guy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrettyFlyForAWhiteGuy): Some of his slang comes across as this, especially contrasted with the others.

[Ramming Always Works](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RammingAlwaysWorks):
    - His strongest limit break finisher, *My Final Heaven*, has him dash with a punch towards, and then *beyond* the enemy to *run one lap around the world* before finally punching. All enemies will be damaged by the sonic boom, or something...which is fairly plausible since the Combat King magazine and animation imply that Zell is traveling at approximately *the speed of light*. - One of his other finishers, *Meteor Barrett* has him charge up a ball of energy, before performing an aerial charge right into the enemy while still holding the energy ball and slamming it right into their face, before dashing beyond the enemy.
[Real Men Wear Pink](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RealMenWearPink): There's an optional quest where you can make Zell admit that he likes this color.
[Red Is Heroic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedIsHeroic): His outfit has red all over it (vest, shoes and his [Infinity +1 Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InfinityPlusOneSword)).
[Roundhouse Kick](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoundhouseKick): The Mach Kick, one of his limit break moves.

[Running Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RunningGag):
    - Will wipe his hand on his pants and present it dramatically for a handshake, but never gets one. - Always missing out on his [Trademark Favorite Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrademarkFavoriteFood). - His tendency to be a [Leader Wannabe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LeaderWannabe) usually either ends with Zell disappointed or Squall reluctantly giving him a chance.
[Shipper on Deck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShipperOnDeck): Like most of the cast, he's a solid Squall and Rinoa shipper.
[Shoryuken](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Shoryuken): Dolphin Blow, where he crouches before hitting his enemies with a flying uppercut, as dolphins jump next to him.

[Shout-Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOut):
    - Possibly to [Marty McFly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Franchise/BackToTheFuture). He's dressed in a red jacket, is very [Hot-Blooded](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotBlooded) compared to the rest of the cast, hates being called a chicken, and for no particular reason two easy-to-ignore/miss cutscenes involve him riding a hoverboard. Then there's the whole thing involving his relations with [Dr. Odine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadScientist) and the timed mission in Esthar... - His facial tattoo is apparently based off of something the developers saw on [MTV](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Creator/MTV).

[Sick Captive Scam](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SickCaptiveScam): Zell uses this technique to  (SPOILER) help the team escape from D-District Prison . He has Selphie and Quistis lie down and act unconscious and tells the [guard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGuardsMustBeCrazy) that a snake bit them.

[Simple, yet Awesome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SimpleYetAwesome): The "Armageddon Fist" technique involves ignoring all the flashier moves in Zell's Limit Break to focus on alternating the two most basic instead. The two moves in question have the fewest number of button presses to execute, and therefore the quickest to pull off. While the fancier moves may do more damage per hit, the longer and more complicated input combinations and the setup required to unleash them means they take more time to execute; especially at higher levels when a good STR junction can mean every individual hit reaches the damage cap, getting out as many hits as possible in the shortest amount of time is by far the most efficient means of racking up the highest total damage.

[Spectacular Spinning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpectacularSpinning): His Different Beat and My Final Heaven final [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) causes the enemy (and Zell himself while attacking, in case of the former) to spin.
[Spirited Competitor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpiritedCompetitor): Zell's outlook in battles. He enjoys challenges but is a good sport.
[Stock Shōnen Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StockShonenHero): He's said to be designed to resemble a typical shonen manga hero, despite not being the protagonist.

[Super-Speed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperSpeed): Duel, his limit break, consists of him being given from 4 up to 12 seconds to strike the opponent with special martial arts techniques exclusive to him. His being able to chain lengthy combos implies a heightened, slowed perception of things, Zell is probably moving much faster than we think. Also, for his last finisher, My Final Heaven, Zell runs a lap around the world in about 4 seconds before using that momentum to punch the opponent with explosive energy.

[Super-Strength](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuperStrength): With his Meteor Strike Duel technique, Zell can lift any enemy in the game, jump up and throw it on it's head. Yes, even colossal beings like Ultima and Omega Weapon. Even outside of game mechanics, Zell is strong enough to casually punch the floor of a train and make it's electrical systems fail.
[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass): In his backstory, he was revealed to be a crybaby.

[Trademark Favorite Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrademarkFavoriteFood): A kind of bread in the original Japanese; hot dogs in the English translation. Unfortunately for him it seems that they're *everybody's* [Trademark Favorite Food](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrademarkFavoriteFood) and the cafeteria is always sold out whenever he tries to get one. (This makes for a minor [Dub-Induced Plot Hole](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubInducedPlotHole) in the ending FMV, where Zell is seen stuffing his face with, and choking on, said flavored bread. However, they can still be seen as bread with hotdogs stuffed in them.)
[Tyke-Bomb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Tykebomb): Ironically, he's emotionally healthier than the rest of the cast since he grew up with a loving adopted family and wasn't forced into becoming a SeeD.

[Unknown Rival](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnknownRival): Zell considers Seifer his [Arch-Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArchEnemy)  (SPOILER) due to the latter bullying him as a child . Seifer, while doesn't ignore him, only considers Squall as his legitimate rival.
[Wall of Weapons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WallOfWeapons): In his room in Balamb, where he has several guns on the wall.
[Wrestler in All of Us](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WrestlerInAllOfUs): Two of his [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) moves, Heel Drop and Meteor Strike.

[10-Minute Retirement](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TenMinuteRetirement): After  (SPOILER) visiting her [Doomed Hometown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DoomedHometown) Trabia Garden , she announces that she would be ending her blog out of fear that she'd reveal her weak side if she kept going. Like most teenagers who make such declarations on the Internet, this doesn't even last one scene before she's back at it.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): She's a fully trained SeeD with both skilled magic and skill with nunchucks (giant sized ones, at that).

[Always Accurate Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AlwaysAccurateAttack): Selphie is the only other member of the party (aside from Squall) who can attain absolute perfect accuracy by acquiring her ultimate weapon, the Strange Vision. Even if she's afflicted with blind, Selphie just can't miss with said weapon. That her weapon is a nunchaku makes it even more impressive.

[Awesome, but Impractical](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AwesomeButImpractical): Searching for her four specific [Limit Breaks](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak) often takes time, and gives your enemies the first initiative to strike.

[Badass Adorable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassAdorable): She's cute as a button and the smallest member of the team, but she'll take down a missile base and maybe even erase you from existence if she has to.
[Beta Couple](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BetaCouple):  (SPOILER) She and Irvine.

[Beware the Nice Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheNiceOnes): As  (SPOILER) revenge for launching missiles at her old Garden, she decides to blow up Galbadia's weapon base while on a mission *with a smile* . Even before that, her casual suggestions for dealing with various situations will inevitably gravitate towards the most violent options imaginable, to the shock of her teammates. In particular, on her *very first mission*, she suggests blowing up the President's train [with a rocket launcher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StuffBlowingUp). While in D-District Prison, she suggests skinning a [moomba](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RidiculouslyCuteCritter) to wear its fur as a disguise. Mechanics wise, she has not one but two [One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill) spells in her [Limit Break](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LimitBreak): "Rapture," which [one-hit-KO's](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill) every non-boss enemy, and "The End," which can one-shot anything up to the [Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss) if you're lucky enough to roll it up.

[Blood Knight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BloodKnight): This is it, time for the main characters and Balamb Garden to finally face Sorceress Edea and the entire might of the Galbadian military. Selphie's reaction? "Whoo-hoo! Garden vs. the Sorceress, the Final Battle. This is so exciting!"
[Character Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterCatchphrase): Selphie tries to get "Booyaka!" to catch on among the students. It doesn't work.

[Character Tic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterTic): Selphie has a few. She tilts her head to the side quite a bit, and if you get out into the world map during the brief moment where she's the party leader, she squats, or adjusts her boots one at at time if left idle.

[Chekhov's Gunman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGunman): She's the [New Transfer Student](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NewTransferStudent) Squall bumps into and can optionally show around the Garden right before taking the Fire Cavern exam.
