[Punch-Clock Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PunchClockVillain): They only work for the Glabadian army and the [Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad) out of loyalty to their friend Seifer.
[Recurring Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecurringBoss): Raijin has to be fought three times in the game, and the second and third times add Fujin to his side.
[Religious and Mythological Theme Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReligiousAndMythologicalThemeNaming): Raijin and Fujin respectively from Japanese thunder and wind deities.

[Shock and Awe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe): Downplayed - Raijin doesn't use any lightning spells or attacks, but is associated with lightning because of his name and because he [absorbs lightning damage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ElementalAbsorption).
[Terse Talker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TerseTalker): Fujin speaks in one- or two-word sentences. In the Japanese version, her dialogue boxes contain a solitary kanji character.
[True Companions](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TrueCompanions): To Seifer, with whom they'll stick through thick and thin.

[Undying Loyalty](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UndyingLoyalty): To Seifer. Fujin and Raijin state that they're on whatever side he's on, which they do for most of the game,  (SPOILER) however, at the end of Disc 3 when they finally feel Seifer has gone too far they call him out on it  but still tell him they will remain his friends.
[Verbal Tic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VerbalTic): Raijin has one, ya'know. FUJIN TOO.

[Wouldn't Hit a Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WouldntHitAGirl): Raijin, during the three boss fights with him, will not attack your female characters. He even says *"I don't hit girls, ya know"* if he KOs all the male members of your party and only females are left. Unless of course, he's blinded.
[Black Sheep](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackSheep): The entire Shumi tribe consider him one for his greed.
[Dirty Coward](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DirtyCoward): NORG plans to deliver the heroes to Edea.
[Dude, Where's My Respect?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DudeWheresMyRespect): His [Berserk Button](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BerserkButton). Not that he deserves any in the first place.
[Entitled Bastard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EntitledBastard): He demands respect from the Garden inhabitants for the sole reason of owning the place.

[Evil Is Hammy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilIsHammy): Very evident even though the game has no voice acting. He shouts every line at the top of his lungs and constantly waves his hands around with wild abandon. It says a lot about his character, considering Shumis are otherwise very modest and make a point of concealing their hands.
[Evil Laugh](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilLaugh): "Fushururu" or "Bujururu".
[Fat Bastard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FatBastard): Huge and morbidly obese to the point of Body horror compared to other Shumis, and a revolting piece of work.
[Greed](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Greed): He is filthy rich but wants to use the SeeDs as mercenary for profit.

[Jerkass Has a Point](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JerkassHasAPoint): Cid admits that NORG's presence was necessary for the Garden to even exist, as he helped arrange the primary source of funding. He also pushed Cid to offer SeeD's services as a mercenary group, which gave the Garden immense support. Unfortunately, by the present day, its clear that those pragmatic ideas were motivated by pure profit.
[Large and in Charge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeAndInCharge): He is 5-10 times taller *and* wider than his subjects.
[Making a Splash](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MakingASplash): He uses mostly water based spells. He also has the water-based Leviathan G-Force, ready for you to steal from him.
[Man Behind the Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManBehindTheMan): He rules Balamb Garden from the shadows.
[Milking the Giant Cow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MilkingTheGiantCow): NORG shows off his hands a lot, despite it generally being considered that Shumi should keep their hands concealed.
[No Indoor Voice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoIndoorVoice): HE SPEAKS IN ALL CAPS TOO! AND UNLIKE FUJIN, HE DOES IT IN A COMPLETE SENTENCE.

[Not-So-Harmless Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotSoHarmlessVillain): A despicable [Smug Snake](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmugSnake) he may be, but contrary to [President Deling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonActionGuy), he has the power to make the bite match the bark.

[Outside-Context Problem](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OutsideContextProblem): By the time Squall's party returns to Balamb Garden to warn them about the impending missile attacks from Galbadia in Disc 2, NORG has his loyalists are causing riots all over the place to root out Cid and his supporters for supremacy.

[Psychic Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PsychicPower): His [Secret Art](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SecretArt) Psycho Blast is a [Sphere of Destruction](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SphereOfDestruction) of psychic energy.

[Smug Snake](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmugSnake): Comes along with being an [Entitled Bastard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EntitledBastard). He treats the Garden inhabitants as [Ungrateful Bastards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UngratefulBastard) when they sided with Cid despite the fact that he never even made his presence known to them and the latter being [A Father to His Men](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AFatherToHisMen).

[Tyrant Takes the Helm](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TyrantTakesTheHelm): Attempts to seize control of Balamb Garden from [Headmaster Cid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ReasonableAuthorityFigure), but is dealt with before he can succeed.
[Wham Line](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhamLine):  (SPOILER)  He is the one who reveals that Cid is married to Edea.

[Ambiguously Human](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmbiguouslyHuman): All Sorceresses are stated to be human women in the game, yet Adel looks decidedly *in*human with her palid grey skin, blank red eyes, blood red hair, pointed ears, and what appear to be horns or antennae protruding from her head. She is also some 15 feet tall and brutishly muscular. Whether this is Adel's natural form or an intense transformation brought upon by her Sorceress powers (or other unspecified means) is still up for debate.

[And I Must Scream](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AndIMustScream): The specifics of her [cryogenic suspension](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedEvilInACan) are unclear: on the one hand, in the cutscene when the seal is broken, she opens her eyes as if waking up from a sleep, yet she [smirks eagerly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PsychoticSmirk) instead of looking confused or freaking out upon suddenly finding herself, you know, in outer space. On the other, back in Disc 1,  (SPOILER) the static disturbing the tv signals in Timber read, "I am alive here", "Bring me back there" and "I will never let you forget about me" – and Adel's sealing device is established as the source of the radio disturbance . This makes you wonder if she really was asleep, or spent her seventeen-year inprisonment conscious, yet totally unable to move, speak or do anything at all.
[Arc Villain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArcVillain): Adel is the main antagonist for most of Laguna's flashbacks. She's also the lingering threat of the Esthar portion of the present day plot.
[Brawn Hilda](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BrawnHilda): Some people may not even realize she's a she.

[Chekhov's Gunman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ChekhovsGunman): She's offhandedly mentioned by minor characters as early as Disc 1, before becoming a major figure in Discs 2 onwards starting the third Laguna sequence.
[Covered in Gunge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoveredInGunge): Out of her jail.
[Curtains Match the Window](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CurtainsMatchTheWindow): Adel hair and eyes are red.

[Dark Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkActionGirl):  (SPOILER)  Even without her body being taken over by Ultimecia,  Adel is a wicked Sorceress bent on world domination and rules Esthar with an iron fist.

[Energy Absorption](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnergyAbsorption):  (SPOILER) She sucks Rinoa's HP throughout the battle. Let Rinoa's HP get to zero (whether by letting Adel suck her dry or [accidentally hitting her with a multiple target attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NiceJobBreakingItHero), and it's [Game Over](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameOver).
[Evil Is Bigger](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilIsBigger): A tyrannical sorceress who waged war on the other nations of the world, and she's much bigger than the other human characters.
[Evil Redhead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilRedhead): Adel has red hair and is said to have been one of the most ruthless Sorceresses to have ever lived.
[Evil Sorceress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilSorceress): One of three that SeeD must fight in the game, and the least visible due to not physically appearing until the final third of the game.
[Facial Markings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FacialMarkings): Covering her face.
[Femme Fatalons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FemmeFatalons): Her fingers are ridiculously long and claw-like, further emphasizing her position as Esthar's brutal ruler and evil Sorceress.
[Fusion Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FusionDance): Forces one with Rinoa, grafting her on her chest to drain her life-force and use as a [Human Shield](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanShield).
[The Giant](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheGiant): She's about four or five times the size of an average human.

tropeName: God Save Us from the Queen!
tropeNotes: [God Save Us from the Queen!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodSaveUsFromTheQueen): Ladies and gentlemen, your malevolent ruler of Esthar!
[Grand Theft Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrandTheftMe):  (SPOILER) Ultimecia possesses her during the [Boss Battle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BossBattle).

[Human Popsicle](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanPopsicle):  (SPOILER) Laguna, with the help of the Esthrar [La Résistance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaResistance), seals her and then sends her containment to space where she will spend her days for the next seventeen years.
[Human Shield](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumanShield): She uses Rinoa as one.

[Lady Looks Like a Dude](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LadyLooksLikeADude): Honestly, would you guess she was female solely from her appearance? She's *huge* and muscular as hell.
    - She is described as a hermaphrodite in the French dub.
[Large and in Charge](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LargeAndInCharge): She's the (former) ruler of a nation, and happens to be about four times the size of an average human.
[Red Eyes, Take Warning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedEyesTakeWarning): Adel has blood-red eyes in the cutscene where she  (SPOILER) grabs Rinoa and junctions her to herself.

[Sealed Evil in a Can](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedEvilInACan): Thanks to  (SPOILER) Laguna's efforts , she was sealed away in a heavily-guarded prison floating in outer space. This alternative was chosen for she was far too powerful to face head-on before the invention of Para Magic. Worse, doing so would have  (SPOILER) caused her to pass on her sorceress powers to someone else .
[Slasher Smile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SlasherSmile): She sports one just before she  (SPOILER) reaches out to Junction Rinoa to herself.

[Sorcerous Overlord](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SorcerousOverlord): This Sorceress actually ruled a country with an iron fist for a while and was one of the leaders of the Galbadian/Estharian war. Then  (SPOILER) she was sealed by Laguna. She never returns to power before SeeD kills her outright.

[Tailor-Made Prison](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TailorMadePrison):  (SPOILER) Laguna and  Dr. Odine create a specially-crafted containment unit to not only seal away her powers, but also put her in stasis as well to completely nullify her. The complex was called "Adel's Tomb", implying it was meant to house her forever, if need be, and was launched into orbit to ensure she could never trouble Esthar, Galbadia, or any other people or nation ever again.  (SPOILER) The tomb only lasts about 17 years before Adel breaks free .

[Unusually Uninteresting Sight](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/UnusuallyUninterestingSight): Don't be confused. That is indeed a Sorcer*ess*. She just happens to be a 15ft tall, masculine-looking, [greyish](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AmazingTechnicolorPopulation) woman with an overtly muscular frame. Yet nobody ever comments on her appearance. This, combined with the appearance of other sorceresses such as Ultimecia, has led to the [Fanon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Fanon) theory that the Sorceress Power causes unknown physical side-effects on each woman which varies from subject to subject.
[Winged Humanoid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WingedHumanoid): Has some pretty sharp wings on her back

[All There in the Manual](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllThereInTheManual): The aptly-named *Ultimania* guidebook greatly elaborates on her character and explains her history and motivations, such as her [Start of Darkness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StartOfDarkness). In the game itself, you only meet her once to fight her, though some information can be gleaned from the things she says  (SPOILER) while controlling Edea .
[Arch-Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArchEnemy): She absolutely despises SeeD and wants to eliminate them wherever she is. And defeating her is their very purpose.
[The Archmage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheArchmage): The most powerful Sorceress of all time, making even powerhouses like Edea and Adel look tiny in comparison.

[Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad): She’s the first true female main antagonist in the series  <sup>note </sup>  while the Cloud of Darkness is technically the first main villain that appears female, it is actually genderless and has merely taken a woman’s appearance as her physical form , and the true root of all evil that must be taken down.  (SPOILER) You've been facing her since the beginning as she's the one controlling Edea and speaking through her in Disk 1, you just don't know this til Disk 3. And that entire disk is spent pretty much finding a way to actually *get* to her to finish her off.

[Boss Corridor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BossCorridor): The last stretch of Ultimecia's castle is a long stone bridge connecting the clock tower with the door to her throne room; the final Save Point of the game is just in front of the door.

[Combat Pragmatist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatPragmatist): She uses several dirty tricks in her arsenal that can throw unprepared players off-balance, from her randomly choosing the initial party (which can include party members with no junctions), destroying stocked spells (which can hit those junctioned to your important stats), and [absorbing party members KO'd for too long into time](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeaderThanDead). Even when her last form's HP hits zero, she still makes a speech that goes on for several more attacks, during which time she can use the [Total Party Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TotalPartyKill) tactic of [Hell's Judgment](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HPToOne) -> [Area of Effect](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AreaOfEffect) spell (either Apocalypse, Ultima, or Meteor). What keeps her from being [Roguelike-level](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Roguelike) cheap is that these tricks are usually too random to be consistently debilitating, making her mostly an intimidating, but fair challenge.

[Contrasting Sequel Antagonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ContrastingSequelAntagonist): To [Sephiroth](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FallenHero) from *VII*. Aside from being opposite genders, both are extremely powerful magic users and both manipulated the events from their respective games, but that’s where the similarities end. Sephiroth was once a loyal member of SOLDIER until he goes mad when he discovers the truth behind his origin; Ultimecia, on the other hand, is a Sorceress from the future that has a personal grudge against SeeD. While Sephiroth sought the Black Materia to summon a Meteor so he can destroy the planet to absorb the lifestream and become a god, Ultimecia seeks to use Time Compression to rule the past, present, and future as a goddess. Also,  (SPOILER) while both spend most of the plot influencing events through proxies, Sephiroth is using the disposable, monstrous clones of Jenova, while Ultimecia is using the attractive and formidable Sorceress Edea.  Finally, Sephiroth is a mostly physical fighter who prefers using his large sword Masamune while Ultimecia primarily uses her innate magic and only becomes physical while junctioning herself to Griever.

[Dark Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkActionGirl): Fittingly for her status as [Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad), Ultimecia is among the deadliest women in the franchise. She has unfathomable power as a Sorceress and is willing to plunge existence into destruction so she can remake it in her own image. She, through possessing Edea and Adel, fights Squall and friends multiple times throughout the game with her winning one of the fights by throwing a spear of ice into Squall, nearly killing him during the assassination attempt at Deling City.

[Dark Is Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DarkIsEvil): Ultimecia is a villainous Sorceress who loves wearing dark clothing as seen through her crimson red dress and black wings in her normal attire and  (SPOILER)  her dark purple dress while possessing Edea.
[Demonic Possession](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemonicPossession):  (SPOILER)  Every sorceress the heroes come across is used by Ultimecia as a shell.
[Driven to Villainy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DrivenToVillainy): Judging by her own words, [persecutions of sorceresses](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BullyingADragon) drove her to seek revenge.

[Eldritch Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EldritchAbomination): Ultimecia's [final form](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneWingedAngel) is definitely this. Not only is she gigantic, twisted, multi-coloured, creepy and oddly symmetrical, with arms at hip level, an upside down version of her human self instead of legs, a dark void with a glowing light instead of a face, and a "gown" below filled with a starry night, against all logic and nature, oh no. Her very existence is a threat to creation, [slowly devouring the entire universe, past, present and future by simply being there!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpacetimeEater)

[Evil Counterpart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilCounterpart): To Rinoa. They’re both sorceresses and their appearances contrast each other: Rinoa has black hair, simple blue clothing and white wings, while Ultimecia has white hair, elaborate red clothing and black wings. Rinoa encourages Squall to open up despite the risk of loss, expressing the healthy outlook that the uncertainty of the future means they should value what they have in the present, but Ultimecia demonstrates Squall's insecurities about the future writ large, railing against the passage of time and attempting to destroy reality via time compression rather than face future loss.

[Evil Sorceress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EvilSorceress): The third and last of the three villainous sorceresses, and the one whom SeeD was founded to fight in the first place. All of their training was in preparation for dealing with her specifically.

[Face-Revealing Turn](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FaceRevealingTurn): The first time her real body is seen is during a flashback to when she  (SPOILER) first possessed Rinoa . Ultimecia's body is shown as a transluscent specter that faces the camera while flying toward it, almost as if she's [lunging at the player](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheFourthWallWillNotProtectYou).
[Facial Markings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FacialMarkings): She has jagged purple tattoos. Two of them are in a [Big Ol' Eyebrows](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigOlEyebrows) pattern.
[Femme Fatalons](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FemmeFatalons): Her hands appear to have been turned into purple clawed appendages.
[Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss): She's the reason SeeD exists, since they were founded to defeat her, and sure enough, Ultimecia, once seen in person, is the final enemy of the game.

[Flunky Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlunkyBoss):  (SPOILER) The fight with her as possessed Edea in Galbadia Garden requires the player to first defeat Seifer for the third time.  In the final battle, she brings out Griever as her GF once her first form has taken enough damage, then she Junctions with Griever for stage 3, during which she can summon Helix enemies to amplify her powers.

[Foil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foil): To main protagonist Squall. Both Squall and Ultimecia encountered hardships in their early lives (though Ultimecia's backstory is [All in the Manual](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AllInTheManual)), resulting in both of them developing nihilistic viewpoints about life. However, Squall is able to [grow as a person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterDevelopment) by creating bonds with others, and ultimately decides that despite life's cruelties and unknowns, it's still worth fighting for. Ultimecia, meanwhile, attempted to [Never Be Hurt Again](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NeverBeHurtAgain) by [literally taking control](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemonicPossession) of others, and using her powers to literally freeze time itself in order to create a world she could rule over without opposition. In the ultimate irony, all Ultimecia's actions do is [ensure her own demise](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfFulfillingProphecy).

[Four Is Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FourIsDeath): Ultimecia is an opponent in some form in four [Boss Battles](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BossBattle) across the game, with the last of these fights, which is the [Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss) battle, having four stages to it (this fight is also on Disc 4).

[Freudian Excuse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FreudianExcuse): What little information the game provides as to her motives implies that, due to being [a Sorceress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlessedWithSuck), she was persecuted all her life because of the terrible actions of evil sorceresses in the past. Not only that, but thanks to history, she knows she is destined to die at the hands of a bunch of teenage mercenaries and all her plans are based on a desperate desire to [escape her fate](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScrewDestiny). Sadly, her actions in the past [caused the start of the persecution of Sorceresses in her own time.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StableTimeLoop)

[Funetik Aksent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FunetikAksent): Though only as herself in her human form before the [Final Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FinalBoss) fight and in the English Translation. She pronounces hard "c" as "k".
[Fusion Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FusionDance): With Griever in the final battle.

[Godhood Seeker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GodhoodSeeker): Ultimecia wants to rule the past, the present and the future at once, as an immortal and completely omnipotent goddess who can decide who and what exists.
[Good Wings, Evil Wings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodWingsEvilWings): Has a pair of black feathered wings
[Grand Theft Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrandTheftMe): Her specialty.  (SPOILER) She's been possessing every woman with sorceress powers all through history.
[Guardian Entity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuardianEntity): Ultimecia creates herself one in the form of Griever.
[Hot Witch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotWitch): She's the token [Ms. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice) of all the sorceresses in this game.

[HP to One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HPToOne): One of Final Ultimecia's attacks is Hell's Judgement, which, like Heartless Angel, reduces the party's health down to one. Unlike Kefka and Sephiroth, she will use this attack quite a bit (and this is coming after the Mobile Type 8 in the Lunatic Pandora prior to Seifer had its own [HP to One](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HPToOne) attack.)

[Inconsistent Spelling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InconsistentSpelling): Some localizations call her Artemisia, which is pronounced the same way than Ultimecia in Japanese and also creates an interesting link with the moon, one of the recurring motives of the game.
[In Their Own Image](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InTheirOwnImage): Wants to destroy the time and space continuum to make a universe in which only she could live.
[Lady of Black Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LadyOfBlackMagic): An elegant, all-powerful Sorceress of Time.
[Male Gaze](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MaleGaze): Her clothes don't leave much to the imagination, and that's probably the first thing you'll notice.

[Manipulative Bitch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ManipulativeBitch): When she's not pulling a [Grand Theft Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GrandTheftMe), she's exploiting the psychological weakpoints of potential minions, both world rulers and Seifer.
[Ms. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice): She's a [Hot Witch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotWitch) who's [Naked in Mink](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NakedInMink).
[Mystical White Hair](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MysticalWhiteHair): The most powerful Sorceress in history, and she has long, flowing silver hair.

[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag):
    - The horns that her hair is styled into resemble the ones on Garland's helmet. Notable as his plan also involved the manipulation of time, and the final dungeon where he was fought also existed in another place in time. - Much like Zemus, the true [Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad) of [Final Fantasy IV](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyIV), her existence isn't revealed until very late in the game wherein it's said that she's actually been the one puppeteering [The Heavy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeavy) (who turns out to actually be a good guy without the influence of the [Big Bad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigBad)).
[Naked in Mink](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NakedInMink): She's [clearly](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperific) wearing nothing underneath her robe.
[Navel-Deep Neckline](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NavelDeepNeckline): The neckline plunges down to her crotch.
[New Era Speech](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NewEraSpeech): In Deling City while  (SPOILER) possessing Edea .
[No Fair Cheating](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoFairCheating): When's the last time you saw an enemy successfully use Dispel on cheat-fueled invincibility?
[Omnicidal Maniac](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OmnicidalManiac): Her goal is to compress time, warping reality to the point that only she will be able to exist.

[One-Winged Angel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneWingedAngel): Twice in the final battle. First through a [Fusion Dance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FusionDance) with her [Guardian Entity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuardianEntity), then by becoming an [Eldritch Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EldritchAbomination) and [Spacetime Eater](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpacetimeEater) out of nowhere.

[Pet the Dog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PetTheDog): Saves Seifer from certain execution without needing to. Sure, [she needed a right-hand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PragmaticVillainy), but this was nice of her nonetheless.

[Physical Goddess](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PhysicalGoddess): In her final form, Ultimecia becomes an [Eldritch Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EldritchAbomination) that emerges from the void and absorbs stars and planets from across the space-time continuum.
[Reality Warper](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RealityWarper): Can alter reality and make real what people think of. In later games, her leaking power is enough to alter the entire country.

[Recurring Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RecurringBoss):  (SPOILER) Ultimecia is possessing Edea both times Edea is fought as a boss, and then she possesses Adel at the start of Disc 4.  Shortly afterward, Squall's team fights her in person, and the first phase of the lengthy final encounter acts like a third  (SPOILER) Edea  battle.

tropeName: Red and Black and Evil All Over
tropeNotes: [Red and Black and Evil All Over](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedAndBlackAndEvilAllOver): Wears a form-fitting red ballgown with black angel wings.
[Red Right Hand](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedRightHand): Her bare black clawed feet.
[Screw Destiny](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ScrewDestiny): Her motivation. Ultimecia wants to compress time to escape her fated death at the hands of the "Legendary SeeD."

[Self-Fulfilling Prophecy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SelfFulfillingProphecy): Ultimecia's [Start of Darkness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StartOfDarkness) was brought about when she was persecuted for the crimes she was *going* to commit, which became common knowledge thanks to the [Time Travel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeTravel) antics of her future self (as depicted in the game). Second, Ultimecia's motivation was to  (SPOILER) use Time Compression to control time and thwart her destined defeat at the hands of the "legendary SeeD". But not only do her efforts to cast Time Compression paint a big bullseye on her chest for SeeD, but her use of the Time Compression spell allows Squall's party to travel to the future and defeat her directly.

[Sequential Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SequentialBoss): Is fought three times when you meet her in her throne room at the end of the game (There's four parts to the final battle, but the second of them is against a monster she summoned).  (SPOILER) Earlier, you fight her as Edea with Seifer at the end of Disc 2, but they are fought separately in the same battle.
[Space Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpaceMaster): Ultimecia controls Space, mostly by isolating three heroes to face the others. *Mobius Final Fantasy* would later expand her mastery of it.
[Spacetime Eater](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SpacetimeEater): Her final form becomes this, with her mere existence being enough to gradually destroy and absorb the entire space-time continuum.

[Statuesque Stunner](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatuesqueStunner): *[Dissidia Final Fantasy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/DissidiaFinalFantasy)* lists her height as 5'10. And she's [definitely a head-turner.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice)
[Stripperific](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperific): Her outfit exposes much of her chest and abdomen and almost all her legs.
[Summon Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SummonMagic): She summons Griever for the second phase of her boss battle.
[Supernatural Gold Eyes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupernaturalGoldEyes): Her eerie yellow eyes pass down when she  (SPOILER) possesses Edea .
[Then Let Me Be Evil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThenLetMeBeEvil): It's implied that she became evil because of the way sorceresses are persecuted in her era.

[Time Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeMaster): Her powers involve time travel and time manipulation, and her ultimate goal is a [Time Crash](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeCrash). *Dissidia* and *Mobius* would later expand her mastery of it.
[Vapor Wear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VaporWear): She does not bother for covering outfits.

[Villainous Breakdown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/VillainousBreakdown): Has two; first, when the party finally meets her in person, she flies into a rage about how they're always getting in the way. Then, once she's forced into her [final form](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneWingedAngel), she [flatly states](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TranquilFury) her new goal to [destroy everything.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OmnicidalManiac)
[White Hair, Black Heart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhiteHairBlackHeart): Her hair is a stark white/silvery color.
[Wicked Cultured](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WickedCultured): Ulty's castle has an art gallery and a cathedral, among other hints as to her favoured pastimes.
[Winged Humanoid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WingedHumanoid): Has a pair of black demonic wings as part of her wardrobe.

[The Woman Behind the Monsters](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheWomanBehindTheMonsters): Sends a handful of evil creatures several times during the game to kill the SeeDs, and has eight guardians in her castle that lock down the abilities of any unwelcome guests who enter; the player must kill most if not all of them to stand a chance against her.

[World's Strongest Woman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorldsStrongestWoman): She is stated to be the most powerful sorceress in history, as such she added all of the sorceress power in existence to her already tremendous magic power gaining god-like abilities. Ultimecia even has complete control over Space-Time magic and can warp-reality to deceive her enemies. She also has her other forms in the final battle that has her powers skyrocketed to a status as a [Physical Goddess](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PhysicalGoddess) that has her become the greatest threat in existence that must be stopped.

[Xanatos Speed Chess](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/XanatosSpeedChess):  (SPOILER)  After Rinoa becomes a sorceress instead of Edea, Ultimecia immediately sees the benefit, knowing that she could feign illness to prompt the heroes to head towards Esthar and Ellone, her targets.

[You Have Failed Me](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouHaveFailedMe): Leaves Seifer to his fate before confronting the heroes under Edea's shell. [Later averts it for she has further use to him after all.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/XanatosSpeedChess)

[You Have Outlived Your Usefulness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouHaveOutlivedYourUsefulness):
    - She kills Vinzer Deling once she's gotten what she wants out of him. - (SPOILER) She uses Rinoa's body to break the seal of Adel's tomb. Once that's done, she leaves her to die in outer space.

[Your Mind Makes It Real](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YourMindMakesItReal): She summons Griever from Squall's mind, with no evidence that it had existed prior to that. If you rename the ring in Disc 2, Griever is likewise renamed. In the final battle, she also effectively Draws Apocalypse, what she believes to be the ultimate spell, from *herself*.
<li style="list-style-type:none;">
<li style="list-style-type:none;">
[Defeat Means Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefeatMeansFriendship): With exception of Gilgamesh, the GFs listed below will join the party upon being defeated, recognizing their strength.
[Dub Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubNameChange): Known as Golgotha in the French version.
[Inconsistent Spelling](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InconsistentSpelling): Often gets spelled as Quetzalcoatl, Quetzacotl, or Quetzal depending on translation and its appearances across the series.

[Mundane Utility](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MundaneUtility): Quezacotl isn't particularly powerful outside of the beginning of the game, but it is useful for its Card Mod ability, which allows you to transform Triple Triad cards into a variety of useful items, which can either be used as is or further refined into powerful magic spells.
[Original Generation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OriginalGeneration): This is Quezacotl's first appearance in the series.
[Shock and Awe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe): The lightning-elemental summon of the game. Its battle ability is Thunder Storm.
[Badass Fingersnap](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassFingersnap): Her first use of it in the series for her casting of Diamond Dust.
[An Ice Person](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnIcePerson): As usual, with her ability Diamond Dust.
[Stripperiffic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperiffic): As usual, she wears little more than [An Ice Suit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AnIceSuit).
[Your Days Are Numbered](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YourDaysAreNumbered): She can teach the Doom ability to your party members.
[Big Red Devil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigRedDevil): He *is* the Fire elemental Guardian Force. He also looks like a combination of man and beast, and is pretty big.

[Breakout Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakoutCharacter): Not this Ifrit, but his new design: This is the first time that Ifrit is shown with a more bestial appearance, compared to previous games making him look like a humanoid. This design was also retroactively used for the *FFVII* version when he cameoed in the *[Super Smash Bros.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/SuperSmashBros)* series.
[Kill It with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillItWithFire): He's a Fire elemental Guardian Force, so this is to be expected.
[Magma Man](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagmaMan): Or beast in this case. He actually [lives in the stuff too](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LethalLavaLand).

[Oh, Crap!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OhCrap): His reaction if you use the GF Shiva against him.
QUOTE **Ifrit:** "They have *Shiva*?"
[Playing with Fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire): Ifrit is the fire GF and uses [Hellfire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hellfire).

[Time-Limit Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeLimitBoss): Played with. Since it's part of Squall's SeeD exam, the player chooses their *own* time limit before entering the Fire Cavern. You have to defeat Ifrit before time is up, but the less time you have remaining when you win, the greater the bonus to your SeeD rank. (You're told to pick a time limit that's doable, but challenging — the test is about accurately judging your own strength.)
[Warm-Up Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WarmUpBoss): [Literally.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire) He is the very first boss you'll fight in the game.
[Hair Wings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HairWings): She has them, and they're feathery to give her more of a bird/angelic appearance.
[Magic Music](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicMusic): She wields a harp to cast Silent Voice.
[The Medic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMedic): Siren teaches healing abilities to the party, such as Life.

[Non-Elemental](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonElemental): Siren does non-elemental damage with Silent Voice, which silences all enemies. The animation involves rushing her enemies with [waves](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MakingASplash), but it does not do water damage.

[Our Sirens Are Different](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OurSirensAreDifferent): It's her name, and when she is summoned she is shown sitting on a rock at sea playing her harp. Her hair resembles wings, giving her a bit of a [harpy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HarpingOnAboutHarpies) look.

[Permanently Missable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PermanentlyMissableContent): If she is not Drawn from Elvoret near the beginning of the game, there is another boss that she can be obtained from in the final dungeon. But if she's not Drawn there, that's the player's last chance.
[Stripperiffic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperiffic): Like Shiva, she wears very little clothing.
[Big Red Devil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigRedDevil): He's even referred to as the devil in the manuals, which is further emphasized by his demonic appearance.
[Dub Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubNameChange): He is known as Nosferatu in the French version, and Diablo in the Spanish version.
[Good Wings, Evil Wings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoodWingsEvilWings): Has a large pair of bat wings, but is only "evil" until the party defeats him, whereupon he joins them.
[Gravity Master](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GravityMaster): Diablos's attack is gravity-based.

[Magikarp Power](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagikarpPower): He does a percentage of the enemy's health based on his level. At level 100, he does 100% of the enemy's health (to a maximum of 9999.) At level 1 though, he only does 1% of the enemy's health. Needless to say, it takes a bit of time before his summon is worth using in battle.
[Our Demons Are Different](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OurDemonsAreDifferent): A [Big Red Devil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigRedDevil) not unlike the big guy himself.
[Permanently Missable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PermanentlyMissableContent): If you [actually sell the Magical Lamp before using it](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TooDumbToLive).

[Puzzle Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PuzzleBoss): He's much less of a [Wake-Up Call Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WakeUpCallBoss) if you have someone in your party with high enough MAG to draw Demi from his available magic to use against him - since Demi does a percentage of the target's HP as damage, this tactic can quickly whittle down his health in only a few casts. In fact, he'll reward the party member who does this <sup>note </sup>  The caveat is that the person must Draw first then cast via Magic, rather than Draw-Cast  by casting Curaga on them, basically as a way of really hammering home how important it is to try to draw-and-cast enemies.

tropeName: Red and Black and Evil All Over
tropeNotes: [Red and Black and Evil All Over](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedAndBlackAndEvilAllOver): Until [Defeat Means Friendship](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DefeatMeansFriendship).
[Sealed Evil in a Can](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SealedEvilInACan): With the can being the Magical Lamp.
[Wake-Up Call Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WakeUpCallBoss): Optional example. Use the Lamp at the earliest point possible, and prepare yourself for a grueling battle.

[Weaksauce Weakness](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeaksauceWeakness): Blind. Diabolos' signature gravity magic can't actually kill the party due to being percentage based, his strategy instead being to bring the party to critical levels so he can one-shot them with his basic attacks. Inflicting blind on him drastically reduces the accuracy of these attacks, allowing the party to comfortably sit at low HP and whittle him down while he constantly misses or ineffectually casts magic.
[Aloof Big Brother](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AloofBigBrother): Minotaur.
[Anti-Regeneration](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AntiRegeneration): Both of them are constantly under the effect of the health-boosting "Regen" buff, which can be dispelled if you cast "Float" on them.
[Bash Brothers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BashBrothers): Literally.
[Big Little Brother](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigLittleBrother): Sacred.

[Big Shadow, Little Creature](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BigShadowLittleCreature): During the second encounter, Sacred tells the party that he's calling on his big brother to aid him, and a for a second the entire screen was engulfed by a huge silhouette, which then shrinks to reveal Minotaur.

[Dishing Out Dirt](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DishingOutDirt): Their element is Earth. They chuck a huge chunk of land with the enemies on them (And then Minotaur chucks Sacred at that same chunk) in the air during their summon, and their boss battle has them continually recover HP as long as they touch the ground.
[Dual Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DualBoss): The second encounter with Sacred involves both him and Minotaur; this is the fight SeeD needs to win to recruit them.

[Dub Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubNameChange): Sacred and Minotaur are respectively known as Tauros and Taurux in the French version, and the GF itself is [Taurus](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StellarName).
[Fastball Special](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FastballSpecial): Poor Sacred.
[Mythology Gag](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MythologyGag): They're based on two bosses from *[Final Fantasy V](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyV)*, Minotaur and Sekhmet.
[Ocular Gushers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OcularGushers): Sacred has these as he's being hurled at the chunk of rock he had thrown into the sky.
[Our Minotaurs Are Different](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OurMinotaursAreDifferent): They *are* minotaurs, after all.

[Red Oni, Blue Oni](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RedOniBlueOni): Hot-tempered Sacred wears red and delivers his dialogue in all caps; his older brother Minotaur is calmer and more sensible, wears blue, and speaks in all lower-case.

[Shout-Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOut): To the [Greek Mythology](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Myth/GreekMythology). Since they're found in [The Maze](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheMaze), the reference is quite obvious. However, they actually owe more to the myth of Antaeus, a son of Gaia who was undefeatable as long as he remained in contact with the earth - as Earth elementals, the brothers regenerate HP as long as they're touching the ground.
[Sibling Team](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SiblingTeam): [Duh.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ExactlyWhatItSaysOnTheTin)
[Attack Reflector](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AttackReflector): Carbuncle grants Reflect to the party and can also teach Auto-Reflect to bounce spells back at the enemy.
[Carbuncle Creature](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CarbuncleCreature): As usual, it's in the name.
[Counter-Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CounterAttack): Carbuncle can teach the Counter ability to the party.

[Permanently Missable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PermanentlyMissableContent): If not Drawn from the Iguions, Carbuncle can be obtained in the final dungeon by drawing from Krysta. But if the player doesn't obtain it there, then it's lost.

[Support Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SupportPartyMember): Like Cerberus, Carbuncle does not deal any damage when summoned. Instead, it casts Ruby Light on the party, which grants everyone Reflect.

[Combat Medic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatMedic): He is an offensive summon, but he also teaches some restorative abilities like Auto-Potion and Recover, and his refining abilities can turn items into support magic or GF recovery medicine.
[Kraken and Leviathan](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KrakenAndLeviathan): As usual, this leviathan is depicted as a sea serpent.
[Making a Splash](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MakingASplash): As usual, he is the water element summon with his ability Tsunami.
[Permanently Missable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PermanentlyMissableContent): If you forget to draw him from NORG (or Trauma in the final dungeon), he's lost permanently.
[Blow You Away](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlowYouAway): Pandemona is the wind elemental summon with its ability Tornado Zone.
[Character Name Limits](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CharacterNameLimits): Apparently intended to be named "Pandaemonium," but it didn't fit.
[Dub Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubNameChange): Pandemonium in the original Japanese, Zephyr in French, Eolo in Spanish and Pandemon in Italian.

[Monstrous Humanoid](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MonstrousHumanoid): It is unclear what exactly Pandemona *is*. It is lavender colored and has a roughly humanoid shape, with (webbed?) claws and perhaps furry feet, with no clear facial features. It also has a fleshy sac that it inflates for its wind attacks to suck up enemies.

[Original Generation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OriginalGeneration): This is Pandemona's first appearance in the series, and in the other times it appears it is typically as a reference to *VIII*, and has not appeared in one of the main-series games since.
[Permanently Missable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PermanentlyMissableContent): If not drawn from either Fujin or Red Giant, it becomes lost.
[Canis Major](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CanisMajor): A huge, three-headed dog.
[Hell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Hell): Well, it *is* where he's from. The ominous-looking gates, blood-red sky, and charred ground are kind of a giveaway.
[Hell Hound](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HellHound): A demonic, three-headed dog.
[Multiple Head Case](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MultipleHeadCase): What else would you expect from a Cerberus?

[Mundane Made Awesome](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MundaneMadeAwesome): Despite what you'd think a dog of hell would do, all he does is apply double and triple to your party when summoned. Considering that Triple is one of the best magics to junction to your stats, he allows you to use three magics for the price of one without going through the precious triple stock.

[Non-Indicative Name](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonIndicativeName): His summon ability, Counter Rockets, counter-intuitively applies Double and Triple to the party rather than inflicting damage or performing a [Counter-Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CounterAttack).

[Permanently Missable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PermanentlyMissableContent): If you miss him, you can still draw him from Gargantua on the final disc. Miss him there, though, and you lose him for good.

[Rule of Three](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RuleOfThree): He has three heads and relies heavily on the Triple spell, which allows him to cast magic three times a turn. Summoning him applies Triple status to the party.

[Shout-Out Theme Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOutThemeNaming): He's based on Cerberus, the three-headed hound who guarded the gates to the Underworld in the [Greek Mythology](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Myth/GreekMythology).

[Combat Medic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatMedic): Offers a powerful attack and teaches the Revive ability. Alexander also has the ability to convert mid-level magic to high level magic and boost the potency of recovery items.
[Light 'em Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LightEmUp): The holy elemental summon, making it effective against undead with its Holy Judgement ability.
[Shoulder Cannon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoulderCannon): For its attack, Holy Judgment, it launches missiles and holy light from massive shoulder-mounted cannons.
[Dub Name Change](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DubNameChange): Glasya-Labolas in the original Japanese version, Helltrain in French and Spanish, and Kharonte in Italian.
[Ghost Train](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GhostTrain): Doomtrain is essentially this, but rather than ghost train it might be seen as a *zombie* train.

[Lost in Translation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LostInTranslation): Its original name was Glasya-Labolas (no relation to the recurring giant enemy), which is why it's summoned using the Solomon Ring (as in *The Lesser Key of Solomon*) using items representing 666. Fittingly, since Glasya-Labolas knows all sciences, Doomtrain has the Forbid Med-RF ability.
[Mundane Utility](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MundaneUtility): One ability it teaches is Junk Shop, which allows Squall to open the weapon upgrade shop from the main menu.
[Number of the Beast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NumberOfTheBeast): He can be acquired by using the Solomon Ring alongside 6 Steel Pipes, 6 Remedy+s, and 6 Malboro Tentacles.

[Original Generation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OriginalGeneration): Unique to *FFVIII*, but Doomtrain can possibly seen as a [Shout-Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOut) to *[Final Fantasy VI](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVI)* with its Phantom Train.

[Status Infliction Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatusInflictionAttack): Doomtrain can inflict poison damage but its main ability is to inflict every status effect in the game with its attack, Runaway Train.
[Breath Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreathWeapon): Mega Flare, as usual. After flying far up in the sky, he charges energy shots from his mouth and lets it all out.
[Humans Are Bastards](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HumansAreBastards): Holds this belief due to being captured and experimented upon.

[Intrigued by Humanity](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntriguedByHumanity): After meeting and battling with the party, he starts decides to become one of the party's Guardian Forces out of interest in them.
[Non-Elemental](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonElemental): His attacks deal no elemental damage, but are nonetheless deadly.
[Sequential Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SequentialBoss): You have to fight at least two red dragons before actually fighting him.
[Cool Horse](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolHorse): Sleipner.
[Cool Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolSword): Zantetsuken, which instantly can kill any non-boss in one hit.
[Death by Irony](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathByIrony):  (SPOILER) An iconic character known for his ability to kill his enemies in one hit is bisected the exact same way.
[Deus ex machina](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeusExMachina)  (SPOILER) Shows up in the fight against Seifer at the end of Disc 3, but gets cut in half for his efforts.

tropeName: Did You Just Punch Out Cthulhu?
tropeNotes: [Did You Just Punch Out Cthulhu?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidYouJustPunchOutCthulhu):  (SPOILER) On the recieving end of this when Seifer casually cuts him in half during the final fight against him.

tropeName: Half the Man He Used to Be
tropeNotes: [Half the Man He Used to Be](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HalfTheManHeUsedToBe):  (SPOILER) If you obtained him before completing Disc 3, he will show up at the start of the fight with Seifer, and get cut clean in half.
[Killed Off for Real](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffForReal):  (SPOILER) If you have him while you fight Seifer. Fortunately, Gilgamesh is there to replace him if it happens.
[Master Swordsman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterSwordsman): The guy can kill anyone with a slash of his sword, cutting them in half.
[One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill):  (SPOILER) By him *and* to him.
[Stealth Hi/Bye](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StealthHiBye): His specialty. He pops up, slashes the enemy in two, and leaves just as quickly.

[Timed Mission](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimedMission): When you reach the Centra Ruins, he gives the party twenty minutes to either leave, or reach and fight him (which inevitably becomes a [Time-Limit Boss](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TimeLimitBoss)). If the timer runs out, it's Zantetzuken time for the party, and an instant [Game Over](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameOver). If they beat him, however, he'll recognize their strength and join them.

[The Worf Effect](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheWorfEffect): He is an extremally powerful summon who [Curb-Stomps](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CurbStompBattle) everything in his path...  (SPOILER) until Seifer returns him the favor in Disc 3.
[11th-Hour Superpower](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EleventhHourSuperpower): Arrives at the very end of Disc 3.
[Badass Cape](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassCape): Of the large and billowing type, especially at the beginning of his summon sequence.

[Call-Back](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CallBack): His entire appearance is one *huge* one to *[Final Fantasy V](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyV)*: Gilgamesh refers to the Dimensional Interval (i.e. the Interdimensional Rift that houses the Void he was banished to) and in the Japanese version, he nearly name drops Bartz, [The Hero](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHero) of *V* and his [Worthy Opponent](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WorthyOpponent).

[Cool Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolSword): He has four, namely; the Excalibur, [Exca](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JokeItem)[lipoor](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CherryTapping), Masamune, and  (SPOILER) [Zantetsuken](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill).

[Deus ex machina](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeusExMachina):  (SPOILER) Shows up out of nowhere in the final Seifer boss fight after 12 turns and literally blows him away before disappearing. This only happens if you completed Odin's challenge earlier; if not, Gilgamesh doesn't show and the SeeDs have to take Seifer out themselves.

tropeName: Did You Just Punch Out Cthulhu?
tropeNotes: [Did You Just Punch Out Cthulhu?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidYouJustPunchOutCthulhu): Did you just  (SPOILER) [Stealth Hi/Bye](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StealthHiBye) Seifer after he killed Odin?  Yeah, that happened.
[Facial Markings](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FacialMarkings): Most of his face is covered, but what is visible of it shows a lot of markings near his eyes and cheek.

[Flight, Strength, Heart](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FlightStrengthHeart): The power of his four swords: Zantetsuken is a [One-Hit Kill](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneHitKill), Masamune and Excalibur are both heavy-hitters, and as for [Excalipur](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JokeItem)...
[Four Is Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FourIsDeath): He has four swords in his arsenal. The fourth and final one he acquires even has the ability to instantly kill.
[Joke Item](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/JokeItem): It's the very weapon he's associated with, Excali*poor*.

[Master Swordsman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MasterSwordsman): Much like Odin, he can kill anyone with a slash of his sword... If said sword is Zantetsuken, otherwise he deals damage or does almost jack.

[Multi-Armed and Dangerous](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MultiArmedAndDangerous): If you look closely though, the arms on his cape are cardboard cutouts, with his real arms on his right side under it and holding his cape.

[Permanently Missable Content](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PermanentlyMissableContent): He is an entirely optional GF, and can only be obtained if  (SPOILER) the player obtained Odin before confronting Seifer at Lunatic Pandora  at the end of Disc 3.

[Power Up Letdown](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PowerUpLetdown): A minor example, but  (SPOILER) he does have a risk of showing up against Adel. Since Rinoa must be kept alive during the fight, but is treated as a target for the purpose of the battle, Gilgamesh will also target her; if he uses Zantetsuken, the battle ends in a [Game Over](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameOver) before it can even start . Fortunately, this only applies to this one battle, and doesn't count outside of it.
[Stealth Hi/Bye](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StealthHiBye): Just like Odin, he leaves just as quickly as he arrives after slashing the enemy.

[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass): Gilgamesh has always been a proficient swordsman, but here he's capable of killing enemies in one hit should he grab the Zantetsuken. Not to mention  (SPOILER) he wipes the floor with Seifer if you don't defeat him first... He does this *after* Seifer has already one-shotted Odin .
[Fixed Damage Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FixedDamageAttack): As usual, Cactuar's ability is 1,000 Needles. However, its damage increases by 1,000 for every ten levels it acquires.
[King Mook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KingMook): Jumbo Cactuar is this to the cactuars.
[Suicide Attack](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SuicideAttack): Cactuar teaches the ability Kamikaze, allowing the characters to do this.

[Brought Down to Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BroughtDownToBadass): He starts off as the Tonberry King. Defeating him turns him into a regular Tonberry that you can summon, which isn't as powerful but is still *very* dangerous.
[King Mook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KingMook): Obtained after defeating the aptly named Tonberry King.
[Level Drain](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LevelDrain): Tonberry can lower enemy levels or even *increase* them to manipulate EXP gained or spells Drawn.

[Mechanically Unusual Fighter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MechanicallyUnusualFighter): Tonberry doesn't learn any Junction abilities and cannot refine any items. Instead, it offers a great boost to Luck and Evasion stats and uncommon support abilities, like letting the person who junctioned it start with a full ATB gauge, gain HP by walking, and manipulate enemy levels. It also gets multiple shop abilities.

[Mundane Utility](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MundaneUtility): Tonberry teaches multiple shop abilities, like Call Shop, Haggle (get a discount at shops), Sell-High (increase selling price), and Familiar (buy rare items at shops).
[Non-Elemental](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonElemental): Tonberry's ability in battle is Chef's Knife, which deals non-elemental damage to a random enemy.

[Angelic Abomination](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AngelicAbomination): Eden is monstrously huge and it is difficult to describe what exactly she is, but a popular fan theory is that she has a link to the Gardens of the game, based on her appearance and name. Aside from the angel wings, she might even be considered to have a roughly jellyfish-shape.
[Eating the Enemy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EatingTheEnemy): Eden comes with the Devour ability, allowing the party to instantly defeat the enemy by devouring them.

[Instant Runes](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/InstantRunes): They appear at the beginning of Eternal Breath's animation as a [Shout-Out](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShoutOut) to Sephiroth's Supernova attack in *[Final Fantasy VII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII)*, being the same Ptolemaic runes.
[Non-Elemental](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NonElemental): Eden does powerful non-elemental damage with her ability Eternal Breath.

[Original Generation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OriginalGeneration): This is Eden's first appearance in the series. It later appears in *[Final Fantasy XIII](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyXIII)*, *[Final Fantasy XIV](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyXIV)*, and is referenced in *[World of Final Fantasy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/WorldOfFinalFantasy)* and the *Dissidia* games.

[Overly Long Fighting Animation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OverlyLongFightingAnimation): Eternal Breath is famous for it, but thanks to the Boost system in *FFVIII* where the player can rapidly press buttons to increase damage throughout the animation, the attack is benefited greatly from it.
